I bought the Men's 8-8.5 for my Ecco boots, but they are clearly short by 1/2-3/4 inch, so I can literally feel the edge of the insole with my toes. Other than that, they are comfortable and do not move in my shoe. I will try the next size up next time.
Also, they are much cheaper than the Lynco orthotics, which I like, but find are quite overpriced.

I was a little skeptical about these insoles, they seem a little bit pricey. But I decided to give them a try & I"m glad I did. I been purchasing insoles from other places Dr. Scholls but they don't work the same as these ones.

These insoles are GREAT!  I have a high arch and these provide excellent support and also add a bit of extra cushioning to my shoes.  I have been able to buy shoes that I would never consider before because they lacked the arch support I desperately need due to plantar fasciitis.  I love that they fit in my shoes without having to trim them, because they come in individual sizes.  I bought a similar pair of insoles a couple of years ago that cost 3x what the Powerstep Pinnacle costs and these are much more comfortable.  I will definitely buy more of these.

I've been having problems with sore feet for a few years.  I went to a therapist that recommended I get a pair of these.  They've worked for himself and his wife.  So, I did, and he was right!  I'll be recommending them to my son who is running and needs extra foot support.
These have been amazing at helping my plantar fasciitis. They are a wonderful alternative to custom orthopedics which are expensive.

My husband has plantar fasciitis. He uses these in all his shoes now and in a couple months his feet got better.  He won't wear any shoes without them. We tried a brace and exercise yet nothing worked until he used these insoles.
These things are awesome, feel like I got new feet!  I now enjoy standing again, I am on my feet all day, and now I am pain free.
Great comfortable insole. After trying 1 initially for a month , I ordered 3 more for all my shoes that are worn on a daily basis
not bad for the price and it helped with my plantar for alitte bit. I had to move up to custom orthotics, but this kept me mostly painfree for a year

I tried several other orthotic models for plantar fasciitis with only limited success.  The Powerstep Pinnacle started to ease the pain immediately and it is all gone after two weeks.  I had stepped on the butt of a cornstalk while walking beans and that is how I tore up my arch originally.
I am switching these to my different shoes and they are making a difference. My feet are flat but the additonal support is making other muscles do their job.

I purchased these for my work boots.  My heels would always hurt after a long 10 hour shift.  These Powerstep Pinnacle insoles helped a little but not fully.  My feet would still be extremely sore after being on my feet all day.  Finally I went to the foot doctor and he advised I have plantar fasciitis.  I then received prescription insoles after have my feet measured and molded.  Luckily my insurance paid for the insoles as they were about 450$.  These powerstep insoles are like putting a Band-Aid on serious problem.  If you want a true fix for painful heels. Go to the foot doctor, none of these generic insoles you can buy from the store will compare to the ones you get from the doctor so save your money.
I have plantar fasciitis and heel bone spurs.  I was pain free within just a few days of using them.
Received the order on time and as stated. Its a pleasure to work with vendors like this making my life easier. I truly appreciate it. Thanks
These relieve my heel pain. They are a must if you have Plantar fascitis (sic). You know it when you have it.
I have had problems with planter fasciitus so I need a real good insole to wear and this has proved to work well for that!!  Will buy more as needed!!

These are a great product. They are really great. The only down fall of the inserts is they do not work with my shoes for everyday use. My foot kept slipping out if my shoe. I would have given these a 5 star but only 4 for this reason.

Yes these definitely helped and keep helping me, I was having a very bad time due to my plantar fasciitis and I tried Dr. S. Nothing, until these insoles got to my feet. Totally made a difference! From day one my feet felt better and now I'm getting better just by wearing them, just keep in mind, if you have real flat feet, you must get use to the arches but once your feet get into it you will be good to go.
The best insole I've ever tried.  I have have high arches & I have at least 4 pairs for all my walking shoes.  They don't fit in western boots.
I wouldn't walk without them.  They are in my shoes now.  The orthotics the Dr. made never worked.  I swear by these insoles and will pay the price whatever it may be.  Thank you.

Everybody's feet are different, of course, and I'm finding every shoe seems to work better with a slightly different insole to relieve the heel pain.  These worked perfectly in my Ryka athletic shoes and gave just the right amount of arch support and cushioning I needed.

Over time I have tried multiple brands of inserts to help alleviate pain from Plantar Fasciitis and until I used these none worked or at best only worked slightly.  These seem to work very well.

Basically I am well overweight and have a lot of foot aches from carrying that extra weight around.  As I have aged it of course has gotten worse.  The plastic inside of these is very, very stiff.  It definitely supports the arches or lack thereof and yet the cushion has enough give to make it comfortable.  The fit of the insoles into your shoes is very good if you order the correct size based on your shoe size.

I will tell you though that you will need to do the following:

Remove the insoles from your shoes. The Powerstep Pinnacles really need that room or your shoes will be too tight, uncomfortable, and more than any other reason you will not be able to lace them properly to hold your foot in a correct and secure position.

You will also need to carry shoes with you for a few days that do not have these inside them because your feet will be very tender for a couple of days while trying to get used to the correct positioning.  I suggest breaking your feet into them over the course of a week or so, adding an additional hour of wearing time each day.

As another tip...to those of you that wear wide shoes....I wear a 9 EE normally.  But when I buy things like cowboy boots, many times I buy them in 10 or 1.5 E or EE depending on their cut.  Always order your Powerstep Pinnacles to fit your true foot size not the size of an oversized shoe.  The reason for this is that the actual arch support will be in the correct position for your foot. If you have to deal with this, you may have to put a small spot of glue at the toe of the Powerstep so that it remains in the proper place.
for someone with plantar... I think more is needed. If someone has only a small problem then they may be enough. In the end for me arch supports worked for a good price.

My right heel had gotten so painful I could hardly walk.  I've tried just about everything I,  and most everyone else, could think of. But, these actually work.  They are a little pricey, but very worth it.
I have been suing the Pinnacle Powerstep insoles for several years now and they are awesome. What more can I say?

I'm using the a couple of years and they work very well for myself, just renewing from time to time.
very gratful to have them.

I've been using these for years in both running and dress shoes.  They provide excellent, firm support.
About 5 years ago, I had plantar faciitus in both feet.  After using these inserts for about a month, the
condition completely went away.  Since that time, I haven't had one foot problem.
I highly recommend them for people who have high insteps.

I started using these insoles six years ago and will not go without them.  They have outperformed prescription inserts hands down.  The price from Amazon is cheaper than buying them in a running store.  The fit in your shoe is no different than any other type of shoe insert.  I will continue to buy these until they no longer make them.

Takes a few 'wears' to adjust to the extra support.
Then my feet feel much better after walking: less pain in my arches.

I have been wearing these for the last 5 years in my running shoes.  I average 20-30 miles per week.  I have high arches and these do a great job preventing the foot strain I had before I started wearing them.

These are the best inserts I have ever had.  They are so comfortable. My feet don't hurt anymore.
I highly recommend them

These orthotics work very well for my wife's active life style. 3-4 visits per week to the Gym for aroebics and tread plus a never-sit-down compulsion and they work as well as her previous othotics from my podiatrist at a fraction of the cost.

Using these inserts for less than 30 days while running; playing tennis my plantar factitious problem went away - as I never had one. Before using them, every morning I had troubled in walking as soon as I got outside the bed. Now no issues. I am buying extra pairs to continue use them going forward.
My sons plays every sport that he can and puts these in all of his athletic shoes.  They provide great support.

First, the insole fit perfectly into my shoe, so I was happy about that. Upon first use, it felt awesome - very cushiony - and in all the right spots. I walk 4+ miles 2-3 times a week and so far, it's held up well (it's been about a month). The great cushiony feeling isn't as noticeable now, but I won't be able to say much more until I get more use out of it.

very comfortable from the first day.
noticed a diffence right away.
so far no problems to report about.
comfort is all it matters.

For the money I think the PP is the best solution for my sore feet. I sometimes work 15-20 days at work and having flat feet I must have some support for my feet or I suffer. I use these insoles in all of my work boots/shoes. These are a little thick to use in some of my dress footwear so in those I use the original Powerstep insoles which are a bit thinner and give the top of my feet/toes a bit more room. It did take me a week or two for my feet to adapt to these but since that time I have had wonderful results. For what they cost I do not consider it a big gamble to try them and see for yourself.
Really helpful in treating my plantar fascitis.  I used Superfeet for several years, but they have not been as effective lately.  With the Powersteps I can walk comfortably again.

I spent ages looking on the internet at which are the best orthotics to buy. I understand it is always a risk buying online, partly due to individual foot shape and what your arch is like. These pinnacles are great with my flat shoes, but I realise it is better to have shoes with a firm shape esp in the heel cup to help give my leg a good alignment (have fallen arches). These insoles are really comfortable and give good support to my feet and am now wearing them with shoes that I had stopped wearing as the soles had been too hard and uncomfortable.
I have not a had a chance to use these yet.  I brought these on a recommendation of a good friend who has the same foot problems as I do.

I have a recurring case of plantar fasciitis.  This time it has moved to my achilles tendon.  My primary concern is that I get relief while playing softball.  I can walk with the inserts with no pain but so far they have not relieved the pain experienced when I run.  It may not be the fault of the inserts.  I may just need to rest my feet longer to give them time to heal.
I have committed blasphemy and put these guys in my ALTRA  Basic Instinct running shoes. Yeah, baby, that's what I am talking about. Life is too short to follow the rules.

I have tried every other manufacturer of insoles out there to only be led down the same path of wasted money and painful heels/arches.  I was looking for an alternative to the podiatrist and expensive custom insoles, when someone recommended these to me.  It takes about a week to get used to them the first time, and actually I think it made my feet hurt worse at first.  But I was determined to find a solution.  I am glad I stuck with these.  it has taken away about 90% of the pain I was having.  This is actually my second pair.

Be warned: Most tennis shoes will require you to remove the factory insole, or it will make your foot too high in the shoe, making it very uncomfortable.
These were recommended by my daughter's physical therapist.  She has 2 pair now, one for her cleats and on for her tennis shoes.
These actually make my feet feel better than the $300 pair the foot-doctor made by casting my feet. Your mileage may vary.

Don't go with the in store brands that have flashy displays. These are by far and away the best orthotic inserts I have used. Great for people with flat feet who spend a lot of time standing. As a medical professional spending a lot of time in the hospital and inpatient setting, they were a lifesaver.

Bought these soles or inserts on recommendation of my Podiatrist.  They are well made and have enough cushion that also helps with the angle it is putting your foot at.  I gave it a four because I think they are over priced!
Bought these for my work boots and my feet feel good after a shift. They will Take a few days to get used to but after that they feel great

A must product if you have plantar fasciitis. It may take a little time for your feet to adjust to the insoles but after they do boy will you be happy you bought them! I would recommend replacing them once every 9 to 12 mos.

I have several sets of these now.  They make a HUGE difference.  I use them in Ski Boots, Hiking Boots, Wading Boots and my daily shoes.  They are much better than what you can get at the drug store.  They are much more rigid.
just what my daughter needed.  she needed arch supports and these came highly recommended by the foot doctor.  She said next best thing to an orthotic
Wouldn't run without them. I have very high arches and have always had a hard time finding shoes that actually meet the top of my instep.  Now I can run in any brand of shoe with these inserts.

best by far tried em all to get through walking on Walmart concrete floor
been wearing powerstep products for 15,years

My husband loves these! His new steel toe work boots were slightly larger and didn't have any support. These insoles made the boots perfect and so comfortable. Best orthotic I've found for my plantar faschitis ...they at least allow me to be able to walk my dog on 30 min walks

A plus.  Great for plantar fascitis.  Can wear it with all my closed shoes.  Was rec. ;by my podiatrist,, and this was the only one she recommended.
The fit is described as bulky in shoes... did not fit and although doctor recommended, were returned immediately as unable to use.

I could only recommend this product for those with a high (perhaps very high) arch. If it helps anyone, I also am a little bit of a supinator and I believe that could be part of the reason why the arch support is so uncomfortable.

I have turned to a competing product the Superfeet Copper DMP, the arch support starts at what I would call medium, then the footbed is supposed to mold to your particular shape over time (no heat required)...  These are much more comfortable for me.

Very sturdy but comfortable insole.  I buy a size 8.5 to wear in tennis shoes and some casuals and a smaller size 7-7.5 to wear in Bob's and dressier casuals were I don't wear heavy socks.  Great price.

I have had problems with plantar fasciitis.  Tried the "older" model of this product and liked it a lot.  Tried this one and liked it even better.  More cushioning and keeps my heel from rocking.  Fits nicely into a pair of running shoes.  Would recommend it.

I have heel spurs and this product aggravated my heel pain.  I went on and bought orthotic inserts and they also caused heel pain.  So far the only thing which seems to work is arch support bands.  If anyone has had a similar experience with PF and has found solutions/ suggestions please message me.
I have been using Pinnacle Powerstep for a few years.  My only complaint is that the nylon covering starts to lift off after a few months when they get wet.
I liked the price on these.  Having purchased them locally in the past, I knew this would work for me.
This a good product. I need them for my arch. I have three sets. They are easy on my feet. I can say that this product is a good buy.

I've been using these for about 5 years now and they work quite well.  I would say my plantar fasciitis is moderate in that I have occasional pain and it is never severe or occurs when I am asleep.  They fit quite well in my Saucony WIDE (E) running shoes.  They probably last about 1.5 years as long as I rotate wearing them with at least one other pair of hoof covers.  I wear a size 12 running shoe and they fit nicely without any cutting being required.  NOTE: I believe you MUST have a WIDE shoe whether it is a casual, dress or athletic shoe in order to get these to fit inside.  Also, whenever possible you will need to remove the insert that comes with your shoe.

I was diagnosed  with Plantar issues begining with heel pain.  Bought this product because I did not want to spend hundreds for othodics from my doctor. I developed a bad case of Plantar Fasciitis on my right foot. It was so bad I couldn't drive because of the constant and sudden pain I had. cant wear a shoe without these i have flat feet and these are great for arch support this is my 4th pair!

Worked like magic with my plantar fasciitis, much better than Dr Scholl's savvier and more expensive pads. I have a high arch and I immediately felt a great arch and heal support and sizes are very accurate.

Very comfortable and the ordering process was easy and accurate.  The insoles were a good price and I would recommend to everyone with problem feet.

My sister has this problem with her feet hurting. She spent 1K for inserts. Her feet still hurt. The day the first pair came and he put them in his shoes he told me the pain was already subsiding. Frequently, before getting the second set, he would be in pain while cutting grass or any other task while not wearing these inserts. So now he has them in 2 pair of shoes and he is virtually pain free!  Buy them if you have foot pain. They absolutely work.
decent grips, firm so easy to move in or out, but after a few weeks or so already have a problem with wear! ok but nothing special!
I run about 1,500 miles per year and I was afraid I would have to start using doctor prescribed orthotics to make my hip pain go away, but these did the trick.  They last about 2 years.
My feet, my knees, my whole body feels better because of these insoles. love them. they turn an ordinary pair of shoes into a wonderfully comfortable pair.

The Powerstep Pinnable Orthotic Insert has helped out a lot with pain in the arch and knees. The product is priced well and holds up very well. I do recommend buying multiple sets so you won't have to take them out of shoes and put into another.
I went 20 years in the military complaining about my feet--I wish I would had found these earlier.  Great product, great support, fantastic comfort.  I will always have these in all my shoes.

So guess where I'm buying the replacement?

-Yup, amazon. This is exactly the same item that came out of my doctor's office a couple of years back. Work great, very durable. Good price and shipping time.
Save yourself a bundle and buy the Pinnacles and put them in every shoe you wear if you have feet issues and plantar problems.

Had been fighting PF for about a month, when a friend mentioned these helped her. A few days later I had them in my shoes and felt instant relief.

They did feel like I had a ball under my arch at first (due to my flat feet), but within 30 min...they were like butter under my feet.

A month later, I am almost ready to start running again, but I will not being doing so without these in my shoes.
I have had problems with my feet for many years, after getting these my feet problems have gone away in about  four months.
I have used the powerstep Pinnacle for all my footware.  I have used this brand the most because if fits my foot type better.  I have a high arch.
These inserts are the best I have ever used in my running shoes.  They make me feel like I don't have plantar fascitis any more!

after wearing these for 2 days I was completely unable to walk, they seem very similar to the super feet green I had been wearing and are a bit more cushioned.  I just think the arch may be in the wrong place for my feet.
might work for someone else but does not work for me

I bought these because my podiatrist recommended them while waiting for my custom orthotics.  They really helped my feet feel better after a new diagnosis of Plantar Fasciitis.  They are sturdy and durable.  This is my second pair.  I wear them in shoes that I plan to get dirty or sweaty or possibly wet (if it's raining or muddy out).  This allows me to preserve the expensive custom ones!  I have no more pain, so I feel they work well and would definitely recommend them for anyone with similar foot pain.
i love these they were worth the money i spent to make my feet feel better, because i couldn't hardly walk for 2 to 3 months until i get these and lord they have done the trick...

I walk 4-5 miles a day @ work in a large big box store. They make all the difference in the world!

Roy
i have suffered with plantar fasciitis heel pain for ever, tried about every remedy up to cortisone shots, this insole have removed the pain

My wife absolutely loves these. She has a moderate-to-high arch and requires good shoes and insoles. I have had an operation on each foot for plantar fasciitis, so I'm very used to wearing the "original" Powersteps in all my shoes.  I love the "pinnacles" even more.  They feel wonderful.
Wish they were a little more ridged (for use with motorcycle) but they have helped a LOT during every-day use

Many years ago I began to suffer from heel pain that got increasingly worse. I stopped at a mall kiosk where they analyzed my problem, which was plantar fasciitis, and recommended these insoles. I noticed immediate relief and have continued to use them off and on for years.
When my husband mentioned he was starting to have lots of heel pain no matter what shoes he wore, I said "You have plantar faciitis, you need Powerstep pinnacle insoles". They are sized precisely, and being removable, one pair will work in many shoes. They do not absorb odors and last a very long time. Highly recommended.

A bit soft arch support , but durable and have good overall quality. For me Pinnacle Maxx was better-but Powerstep so far for me was the best insert. For some reason the price is quit high-they sold for $22 (including shipping)

Next only to my 650$ prescription orthos. For
under 50$, this is great value.  I would definitely come back and purchase more.
I bought these for my running shoes. They work really well. I have high arches and they give me the support I need. They are not as cushioning for my heal as I thought they would be.
This is exactly what I needed for an extra pair of shoes.  Normally I prefer to buy locally but the price of these insole was to good especially when you need more than on pair.

I have tried many, many different orthotics and these are right up there with the best.  Didn't completely get rid of my plantar fasciitis pain but did greatly diminish it.  Very good product, especially for the money!!

My doctor seemed to think I had a heel spur in my left heel (I didn't have x-rays to confirm so it may have just been plantar fasciitis). I bought these with little hope that they would help. I had done stretches also to help with the pain and it may just be a coincidence that it healed within the same time that I purchased these but I would buy these again in a heartbeat!  Well worth their price.  If anything at all, they are great cushions for your feet in general!
THESE CAN BE USED IN ANY WALKING OR RUNNING SHOE. SAVES ME MONEY WHEN SHOE SHOPPING. I RECOMMEND IT FOR NURSES
Fit well in my shoes and offer comfort and support without being too stiff. Have been holding up well, and would definitely recommend for those with feet problems.

The insoles themselves are very good but have gotten expensive.  They are about $11.00 more than when I purchased them a year ago.  The shipping was incorrect.  I ordered 2 pair one was the right size the other not so I had to return them.  The return policy is good at Amazon so it wasn't too much of a problem... just finding a UPS drop off site in the area. .

This particular rigid insole was recommended by my podiatrist. I have been using Powerstep Arch supports for 10 years.
I never felt the need to try any other brand or type of orthotic insole. I have recommended this product to several friends.

I did not feel comfortable with the $400 orthotic from a podiatrist. It simply did not feel good. With this Powerstep insole I am back walking 5 miles a day at a good speed and having little if any pain in my plantar fasciitis foot. I have bought 2 so far and will buy 2 more in the next weeks so I don't have to move them from one shoe, sneaker to another.

At the top of the stairs in a dark theater, have you ever stepped up over the last step and realized too late that there were no more steps, and then slam down hard with the last step? That is what I did.  Instant Morton's Neuroma. I was unable to walk without pain, even with the best shoes.  A few years later, someone at the running store recommended Powerstep Pinnacle Orthotics.  I could walk without pain for the first time in two years.  Then I started running again, building up my miles to 20-30 miles/week.  No pain!  I still have the neuroma because I can start to feel it again if i go barefoot outside or wear sandals without the orthotics.  I have given these orthotics to many people as gifts.
I have had no more pain in my feet since using these insoles and they are much cheaper than the cost of custom ones

Good support for the whole foot, but some may find the arch very high. I noticed it a lot on the first three days, now I'm getting used to them. A very expensive, premium insole, so far I'm liking what I got for the purchase.

If you have limited space within your shoe, I have to warn you that these might be too thick. My feet are pretty thin so they work for me, but I could see how it could be too much insole for people with thicker feet. They provide great cushioning and arch support, though.

I've tried the Powerstep Original as well as the PInnacle.  Don't bother with the Original -- like a piece of thin cardboard.  But surprisingly, the Pinnacles are great -- offering cushioning that's comfortable without being overly spongy, and adequate support relative to my particular problems (obviously, anyone needing an orthotic has a problem and needs to find the particular product that works for them).  I have very expensive prescription orthotics and have been trying to find a cheap, over-the-counter alternative.  While the Pinnacles are not as good as my prescriptions, they work quite well for me, and it's a relief to have found something relatively inexpensive, readily available, and nicely made.
This was a recommended purchase by my foot Dr.  I could not get them into my shoes I haven't really used them yet, but I am sure they will do what is intended for them to do.

The product delivers 100%. My wife is a kindergarten teacher and has to be on feet for eight hours a day. For last 2 months she started feeling pain in her legs. The pain used to extend upto thighs. After school she used to take painkiller and just lie down in bed. In morning she used to get up with heel pain. She could feel the difference within one day of using it and after one week use she has practically recovered. No more painkillers and taking reast after school. Highly recommended.

My husband, 33,  has suffered from plantar fasciitis for several years.  He has a job where he wears steel-toe boots and is on his feet 8-10hrs a day.  The pain comes and goes, always worse in the morning.  In order to relieve the pain, he does the foot exercises regularly. In the past, he has also had cortisone injections.  We've purchased the nighttime boot, the supports that can be worn barefoot/sandals, all sorts of muscle ointments - you name it.  When the Dr. recommended special orthotics we were shocked at the price of having them made.  It was especially disheartening when we learned that our insurance does not cover the orthotics.  Double Ouch!

So, long story short, we tried many, many types of insoles.  2-3 weeks after wearing the PowerStep Pinnacle orthotic, he was able to get up in the morning without hobbling/limping.  Now, after 6 months, he has no pain.  I think that the hard arch makes the difference.  The orthotic doesn't wear out nearly as fast as the other brands.  I purchased 2 originally, and we are just now needing to buy replacements.  I definitely recommend trying this product!

*** Bonus: the insoles do not absorb and retain the "normal" stench that the other brands do.
Great product . I just love it. It has solved my plantar fasciitis problem.  I hope they never stop making them!

I have a forefoot neuralgia and need an insole that provides good arch support and decent padding. The Pinnacle Orthonic Inserts provide that better than anything else I've tried, and I've spend hundreds of dollars over the years searching for foot comfort. The inserts are medium to high volume so might be uncomfortable for people with less arch to their feet. The inserts have some padding, but not as much as the Pinnacle Max inserts, though they do take less volume inside my shoes.

I was suffering from "nerve pinch" in both feet that required chiropractic treatment. My Chiro-Doc recommended an arch support and I eventually came across this product. It takes a little time to get used to the insert, but the "nerve pinch" problem has disappeared.
These are the best insoles i've ever used.  They have made a huge difference in the heel pain I was experiencing from plantar faciitis
My feet feel good finally.  Able to walk all day without the pain that I was experiencing.  Extremely happy with these.

Excellent service, quick & free shipping, price better than elsewhere.  The orthotics are comfortable and slide easily into most of my shoes.  This brand was recommended to me by my Podiatrist, but I couldn't find them anywhere (locally) in my size.

If you are a runner and need a good orthotic, this deal is awesome. You can't find these for less money anywhere! Believe me I have looked.  My wife has been using them for years and this is the cheapest I've ever found. I'm buying a second pair just in case the deal runs out.
Would recommend these for people who need foot support and do alot of walking.  Take a little getting used to but am glad I purchased them.

I am a runner with  Plantar Fasciitis in my right foot.  Been using a combination of these inserts and tape for added support and the results have been great.  I'm on my feet a lot and these are the best supports I have tried.  Highly recommended.
Great for my 60 year old active feet.  I like to keep a pair in my slippers that I wear around the house when I come home.  Feel wonderful.

very comfortable and helped my heel pain..just need to wear it all the time to get full benefits. Still worth it!

Purchased as inserts in my spouse and my shoes.  Have really helped both of us in more comfortable walking. Several foot doctors and their patients are the ones who recommended to us this particular brand.  There may?? be/have been other acceptable brands but I have NOT tried them so I cannot compare this brand to others.  The price of this particular brand is in the ballpark with other brands I found on-line; since my spouse and I are really pleased with this brand, we have currently decided to stay with these.

An alternate to the orthotics provided by my podiatrist. They are more comfortable as they have some cushioning rather than the hard plastic in my prescription orthotics. That does mean that the do wear out but I have gotten over a years worth of use out of the first pair and still use them in my older shoes.

I finally need to buy a new pair now after two years. These arch supports are so good that the best compliment I can give them is this. I had a chiropractor give them the thumbs up after trying to sell me custom made orthopedics through his business. I cannot afford those, and indeed, had to wear custom made inserts in my shoes as a child. These rank right up there. Will be buying another pair for myself and the significant soon.

They fit great, provide much-needed support right where I need it, and they stay put in the shoes without adhesive, which means I can move them between shoes with ease. Nonetheless I have 3 pairs for convenience, and to spread out the wear and tear.
Best insert I've found
and this model seems as good as the others. I received my first pair from my doctor, and I now replace them via the net: identical product at a lower cost.

An ex-football player past his prime (6'3", 360 lbs, size 13D, medium arch), I was recently diagnosed with plantar fasciitis. My orthopedist recommended daily stretching exercises and Orthoheel slippers to wear indoors (no more walking around in socks). What a difference! The slippers and exercises lessened my symptoms from the start and, over time, eliminated most of my discomfort, so I decided to find some orthotic inserts to improve my street shoes.

So far, I've tested:
1. Dr. Scholl's Massaging Gel Extra Support
2. Aetrex Copper Medium Arch
3. Spenco Polysorb Total Support
4. Superfeet Copper DMP
5. Powerstep Pinnacle
6. Powerstep Pinnacle Pro

each for two hours' total walking time over a few days in two pairs of my favorite shoes: New Balance 606 hikers and Cole Haan loafers with Nike Air.

Dr. Scholl's Massaging Gel Extra Support: Advertised for big & tall men, they didn't do much for me. While the extra cushioning helped at first, it helped less and less the longer I walked on them. I mentioned this to my orthopod and he told me the key to managing PF is not cushioning, it's support. Grade: D

Spenco Polysorb Total Support: Remembering my doc's advice, I chose these for the rigid heel cup and arch support. Though quite comfortable overall, the arch support was a bit too low for my medium-high arches and the heel cup was insufficient support for weight. While they worked reasonably well for me, I believe they would a be better choice for lighter individuals with lower arches. Grade: B

Aetrex Copper Medium Arch: Promising better arch support, these felt very similar to the Spenco insoles even after walking around the block. I then swapped one of the Aetrex insoles for one of the Spenco insoles and walked around again. Only then could I tell them apart. The Spenco offered a little better support for the mid- and fore-parts of my foot, the Aetrex offered a little better support for my arch. Grade: B

Superfeet: I was in an Allen Edmonds store and noticed the Superfeet insoles. The clerk said many men my size have good success with them. I tried the Orange and the Copper DMP versions in the store. Finding the Orange too high for my arches, I got a pair of the Copper DMP. These are easily the most rigid of the insoles I've tried...and easily the best. Superfeet arch support sits farther back on the insole than other brands. This made a real difference in the support and comfort I felt walking long distances. I also found the medial post support in the heel did a better job than other insoles in combatting over-pronation. Grade: A [Update: I have since tried Superfeet Black in dress shoes that couldn't accommodate the Orange insole. They work well but are not as supportive as the Copper.]

Powerstep Pinnacle: While it seems well-made and offered good support, it simply did not work for me. The gel-based arch support sits too far forward and in the middle of the insole. The insoles felt like I had lumps of clay underfoot. After a few blocks of brisk walking, my feet began to fatigue as if I were walking barefoot in sand. Again, these may work for some people but they didn't for me. Grade: C

Powerstep Pinnacle Pro: Other wearers commented that the Pinnacle Pro differs markedly from the Pinnacle, so I tried a pair. I barely made it a block before heading back home. Though more rigid than the Pinnacle and with a better heel cup, the Pinnacle Pro was too inflexible through the arch and ball of my foot. These were the only insoles I tried that truly caused me pain. Of course, it could just be the contours of my feet, and for others the Pinnacle Pro might be great. Grade: F

these are different than most because they are fairly rigid, where most supports you can fold in half, but not these. They are still comfortable yet stronger than most you can find in the stores. I feel they are as good as the $250 they are trying to sell at these fancy foot stores, for only $30 or less. The foot stores act like they are scientifically looking at your feet and then they say stand on one of 3 models and tell me which feels the best. I don't need a person to tell me figure out for myself if they feel alright or not and then try and charge me $250-$500 for a non custom orthotic. These are more expensive than the ones you'll find in Meijer, etc. but much better built and much cheaper than the so-called foot stores.

Overpriced and not a direct fit. I woule recommend one buy this procuct somewhere other than on line as you need to size it.

Great help for my aching feet!!!  Ordered more to keep in my hiking boots.  Less expensive than local Foot Store.

I got this for my shoes that has still room to put it in and got the Maxx Orthotic supports for the other shoes that has enough room to use it.  Now I could save a lot by buying just regular shoes  and use this Powersteps instead of buying very expensive special shoes.

I have problems with plantar fasciitis, and these have worked miracles for me. I'd say the Pinnacle insoles are what helped to really overcome the pain, and using the Pinnacles and Birkenstock insoles has thus far prevented the pain from returning.
I've tried a number of brands and this is my very favorite. Gives me so much more stability when I run or walk.

My only reason to not give it 5 stars is that I'm not cured yet, and because they seems a little pricey for a piece of plastic that you put in your shoe.

I frequently purchase these inserts for myself and for my husband, who has had several foot surgeries.  I like that it provides excellent support, but is not rigid. great fit, had no problem with order. can on the date they said it would, super super super really super

I bought the Powerstep inserts to try to transition away from an older prescription orthotic that I had been using for years.

After researching all the options, my solution was to go with a prescription orthotic that was molded to my foot while standing. That's given me the best result so far.

My wife is on her feet all day and has been trying different insoles and shoes for quite some time.  After finally getting some professional help, she was referred to these arch support insoles and they've done wonders.

Before going to my foot specialist, I decided to look on amazon.com and see if there were any over the counter inserts that could do the job.  I figured if they worked, i would save myself hundreds of dollars.  If not, I figured I was only out 20-30 bucks or so.  I saw the reviews for these and decided to buy.

I'm 6'0, overweight, and am in my late 30s.  I am trying to lose weight and have been exercising for about a year now.  Although my weight is dropping, I wanted to incorporate running into my regimen (in addition to the spinning classes) to lose weight quicker.  I haven't run since I was in my early 20s.  Since then, I've found it increasingly painful to run with flat feet.  My shins, arches, get so painful, even after running a few minutes, that I had to stop even though I could have gone on for a while despite that.  Additionally, even during the normal workday, or when traveling and running around airports, I found that my flat feet were giving me problems, even when buying expensive shoes, e.g. Ecco shoes, etc.

I got these and had some minor discomfort during the first few days.  I imagine it's just from the initial getting used to the inserts.  I've been wearing them now for about 2 months and the pain has gone away.  These inserts have been incredibly effective.  I realized just how effective when last week, during a "boot camp" type class, we had to sprint at various points in the hour.  Initially I started feeling the tell-tale pain in my shin and arches, but soon the pain disappeared.  I was really amazed that I could run, and run and run without pain!  I haven't run pain free for many years.  This was the high point of the past couple of months.  The persistent back pain that would appear after being on my feet at the airport all day, or in the office all day, has gone.  I am really amazed.  I was so amazed that I told my father about these as well.  He has flat feet and is a runner.  He's not overweight but still ahd many of the same pains I had in the shins and arches.  Since wearing these, his pain has also gone.  GET THESE before you guy ortho inserts!  They work!
Great product that was recommended by the podiatrist for overpronation. Insurance would not cover orthotics, so this was an alternative.

After reading about Plantar Fasciitis on the internet, I decided I needed to get some type of orthotic device for my shoes.  I bought 3 products to try out: ProFoot Plantar Fasciitis Men's Orthotic Insert, the Dr. Scholl's PRO for Arch Pain Relief inserts, and the Powerstep Pinnacle Insole.

Out of the three, the ProFoot helped the least.  To provide really good arch support, the arch part of the orthotic needs to be quite firm.  The arch area on the ProFoot is just some type of foam rubber and in my opinion doesn't provide much support at all.  It's just too soft and not thick enough.  If you have a pair of shoes that only need a slight amount more of arch support, then perhaps these would work for you, but if you are suffering from plantar fasciitis (like I am), I think more suitable products are out there (that cost more money, of course).

The Dr. Scholl's that I mentioned before are OK, but not perfect.  I have a pair of tennis shoes that will not accommodate a full length orthotic, so I like it because it doesn't go all the way to the toe.  I needed a little more arch support in those tennis shoes, and the Dr. Scholl's worked better for me than this ProFoot model.

Lastly, the Powerstep Pinnacle Insole was the most expensive of the 3 (around $23) but it provided the most arch support (perhaps even a bit too much if the shoes already have decent arch support built in).  On the Powerstep arch supports, the arch area is reinforced with hard plastic which keeps it shaped correctly.

I had plantar fasciitis for several months, and using the Powerstep supports in a pair of New Balance tennis shoes (they don't have a whole lot of arch support built in), the pain has nearly gone away in about 3 weeks.  Keep in mind that besides wearing arch supports, I also modified the way I do step aerobics at the gym.  I was on my toes way too much, and now I understand why the instructors say to let your heel go all the way to the ground every time, instead of being on your toes all the time.  Also I controlled the force of my foot coming down.

Plantar fasciitis, bunyons, knee problems, and I'm a runner. These insoles are amazing-- less than a week and I'm already feeling better. I'm going to buy another couple of pairs so I can have them in all my shoes. Note: I have high arches, and most insoles don't come up high enough to do me any good. These are great.

My very flat feet feel great now. I bought two pairs from Amazon for about $40. Love them. This product provides solid arch support. I purchased a similar power step product last year and they have
held up quite well. The insert is worn a bit but still provides solid support. I have had great success with the Powerstep line of products. The Amazon price rips apart the big "Feet" franchise out there who wanted over $540 for two pairs of some other "state of the art" product. Yikes! Incidentally, my podiatrist charged me $145 for my old Powerstep pair purchased last year.

Thanks Powerstep for a great product. Thanks Amazon for great price. Shame on the podiatrist for overcharging me ):

I bought these for my plantar fasciitis. They really help but wear out way too fast. I can tell after about a month that they are worn because the PF pain starts coming back. I walk a lot, 25+ miles a week. It would be nice if they were more durable or cheaper.
My son has really flat feet and these are comfortable and give him good support. He was able to walk all day.

I've been using Powerstep Pinnacles for over 7 years and I won't wear shoes without them. I have severe back pain and have had insoles from the doctor, but none feel better than the Powerstep that cost a fraction of the price.
I bought these insoles to replace the ones I got from my podiatrist for my heel pain.  My pain is going away and I bought it for less than my podiatrist charge me.
These where to replace my very old orthotics that were prescribed by my foot doctor. They work just as good as the 300 dollar ones I got from the doctor.

I had very painful plantar fasciitis for 2 years.  I tried custom orthotics from the podiatrist and they actually increased my pain.  I was desperate, even tried the Dr. Scholls custom fit inserts, which worked slightly.  I have Powersteps in all my shoes now.  I knew from the first moment I put them in my shoes that these were different, and my feet may have breathed an audible sigh of relief! ALL my foot  pain was gone in a week.  Awesome product.  I recommend them to everyone I know who has foot trouble.

I bought these as I was having issues with Plantar fasciitis.  It really helped move along my healing process. I put them in my workout shoes and wore them everywhere for a few weeks. I was to the point that I couldn't even walk on my foot when I got out of bed. It took about 1 month of wearing them and my foot is all better and no more pain. These worked great. They do increase the height in your workout shoes even when you take out the insoles that come with the shoe. I had to loosen my laces a little bit to get my shoe to fit comfortably but other than that there were no more adjustments.

I love these insoles.  I only buy high end hiking type shoes and motorcycle boots (i.e. Merrell, Keen, BMW, & SIdi) and I put these insoles in every one.  They sell them at the local hospital but for a premium compared to Amazon.com.  My podiatrist recommends them for plantar fasciitis and they work very well.  Very good arch and heel support.

superfeet are better, yes. Are they miles ahead, that doesn't seem to be true. These are fine, supportive, and almost as good...for a much better price. after that, its your call if you have cash to burn.

My archs were throbbing so badly after my runs I was forced to stop entirely for about two weeks.  I got these was was utterly amazed.  I even wear them at home from time to time.  Going to buy a few more pairs so I won't have to keep swapping them out!  I can't recommend these enough.  Get them if you're having any sort of discomfort and don't want to spend a few hundred dollars on custom orthotics.
feel funny for a few minutes, then extremely comfortable. would purchase again. good size. one two three four five six seven eight nine ten
Product is fantastic i no longer have to listen to my wife complain about her heels oh my heels. Simply works!
Once I put these in my shoes, I could no longer get my foot in my shoes without horrible pinching. I returned them.

Just developed plantar fascitis & did some research & these inserts were recommended.  Got them & put them right into my tennis shoes & boy have they made a huge difference!  I can really tell when I'm not wearing them, as the pain in my heel comes back pretty quickly.

I have Plantar Fasciitis in my left foot and the Powerstep Pinnacles are the best insole that I have found in years of looking.  I paid over $200.00 for some special made insoles but they didn't work as good as these.  I bought these to go with my New Balance 927 brown shoes.  My Plantar Fasciitis is gone.  I don't wear any of my other shoes without these Powerstep Pinnacle Orthotic Inserts.  These are the best.
I just bought more pairs for my other shoes. This is the best product I have used so far for my high arch. I used many other kind of insoles, but this one really stands out.

I had plantar fasciitis so bad on my right heel that I was convinced I needed surgery. My doctor recommended these and I was amazed at how quickly the pain went away. Today, I have no problems hiking miles and exercising on the elliptical machine. These were the best medicine I have ever bought. I wear a pair to work and in my exercise shoes. Cannot recommend enough.

My Husband wore these inside his work shoes and they came apart after 2 months of continuous use.  They fit well and gave good support,  but the top layer peeled off they the whole insole came apart.

These will probably be fine for normal use,  just don't expect them to last!
So far so good. These are well made and feel springy.  My knee doc recommended them, as my orthodics from podiatrist started to hurt.  These are softer than those but good arch support.

These work okay for dress or casual shoes. Relatively easy to swap between shoes. However, in my experience not good for athletic shoes. Too wide to fit into my volleyball shoes. When I use these for tennis, I feel the bottom of my feet burning because there is too much friction. A better alternative is Superfeet 3/4 easy-fit insoles. Never tested these for running so cannot comment on that.
I have been using these for several years now. This is an excellent product and I would highly recommend these for any one with foot issues that doesn't want to spring for custom insoles.

I am so happy with these insoles.  I've always had problems with my feet - flat feet/fallen arches - and I've tried insoles of various kinds.  Most of them helped a little, but these insoles made all the difference. They are comfortable and fit my shoes well.  I transfer them from one pair to another, but I am going to purchase more so I don't have to do the transferring.  They have worn well, and I do a lot of walking.  I highly recommend them.

I'm a big, muscular, 270-lb guy with flat feet. For years, I have wanted to take up running, but I could never get past the shin splints that come from my flat feet and extra pounds. I have been trying to compete in triathlons, but the pain in my lower legs was almost unbearable.

Recently, a friend of mine recommended Powerstep Pinnacle insoles. I put them in, went for a jog, and immediately noticed the difference. Since receiving the insoles six days ago, I have already ran 14 miles with absolutely no leg pain whatsoever.

My wife even remarked that she can see a positive difference in my posture while I'm wearing the insoles.

So, I just purchased a second pair for my everyday shoes. These have been a godsend.

Thanks Powerstep!

It makes my shoe more comfortable to wear, but the front part supporting my toes worn out quite fast. Not sure why. Would like it to be more durable. Yet still buying them, since haven't found better alternative

I bought these because I started working out about two years ago and was having foot pain after doing anything upright for longer than 15 minutes (a bone on the ball of my foot extends down too far plus my arches are weird plus tight tendons, blah, blah, blah). I finally found a pair of New Balance shoes that allowed me to work out for over 30 minutes before discomfort set in, but wanted to go longer so decided to try OTC orthotics as the last step before custom ones.

I am so glad I tried these! These orthotics were the last ingredient to relieving my foot pain for the full hour it took to work out!!!  LOVED 'EM!

As they're won't to do, my beloved shoes finally wore out, the next pair didn't fit the same, and I ended up back at Square One. Got fitted with some Brooks and let the store folk talk me into a pair of their twice-as-expensive OTC orthotics, only to find they didn't do the trick. So just in case, I ordered another pair of the Powerstep Pinnacle ones, and relief for my LEFT foot was instant... but interestingly enough, my right foot wasn't so happy. NO worries, I just use the shoe's normal insert on my right, the Pinnacle on my left, and VOILA, I can work out pain-free again!!!

Random side note... for those of you who are - like I was several months ago - on a quest to find the perfect shoe and perfect orthotic for weird feet so that you can do any time of workout at any time, and was researching stuff online and devouring reviews for anything foot-related, let me add this: I have found that I need diff shoes and diff types of orthotics for diff activities.  Unfortunately, it's all about the combination, so I've had to give up my dream of one-size-one-type-one-insert-works-for-everthing. Good luck!!!

My doctor recommended these insoles to me after telling me that I over-pronate, which causes me twinging pains in my knees. Since using these, the twinging pain happens much less frequently even though I work anywhere between six to nine hours on my feet in a pharmacy. They don't come in their original box though, which is the only thing that makes me a bit leery of ordering online rather than getting them specially ordered at my local athletic store. Once they have worn out, I use the insoles in my heeled boots, just so they fit more snugly and are more comfortable. I would strongly recommend this insole to anyone looking for comfortable inserts!
They fit perfectly, were shipped in real time, and perform great. Would recommend these versus Dr Shoals at twice the money.

I have plantar faciitis that developed last year from jogging. These inserts fit great into my running shoes without modification. They feel very supportive on my arches. I tried running for the first time last week with these in and my arch pain has subsided greatly when I run! No more shocking painful jolts! Hopefully these will continue to hold up and help give my poor tendon a break. :)

These orthotics make the difference in being able to get up and walk each morning. Before, I would limp around the house for an hour before I could really be on-the-go.  At 40ish, I am too young for that!

I'm 28 years old and up until now I've never had any need for extra support for my feet.  However, after playing roughly a month ago my heel/achilles started to bother me to the point it was difficult to walk.  I did some research and found the Powerstep Pinnacle inserts.  Based on the overwhelming positive reviews I gave them a try and they really have helped.

They take a little bit of getting used to (if you've never worn inserts before) as they're a bit stiff and add a decent amount of thickness inside the shoe.  I put them in a pair of Adidas Sambas, and while they fit, its significantly more snug.  Also, they're a bit too wide for the shoe and will require trimming for a perfect fit.

All and all they've help take off some pressure and pounding on my heels and my feet have felt better ever since!

I was surprised at how uncomfortable these were in my Saucony Cohesion athletic shoes. I have used Powerstep Pinnacle inserts before with positive results in Asics shoes. I have an extremely high arch and a narrow heel, but not particularly narrow feet.

1) The worst problem was the width of the insert. While the arch support of these inserts is excellent (significantly better than the green Superfeet), the insert is wide in the heel and in the area of the arch, resulting in stretching the fabric of the shoe outward. It also seems that, due to the width of the insert, it may not fit flatly into the bed of the shoe; in my case this resulted in the left insert tilting upwards on the instep, so that the arch of the insert made significantly more contact with the arch of my left foot than did the right insert. The heel cup is also pretty wide, certainly wider than the Superfeet equivalent. I wear these shoes all day at an active job and have developed leg fatigue, foot pain and now have shoes that are stretched out in the arch, giving less support than they did before in the inserts.

2)Oddly, given the width of the rest of the insert, the toe region is particularly narrow and short. Although I purchased the correct size to match my shoe, the length of the insert was maybe 1/2" shorter than the toe bed of the shoe, so my toes ended up sticking out over the top of the insert. While not particularly uncomfortable, it was annoying.

Perhaps this particular shoe and insert are incompatible. The instructions for the insert indicate to wear them intermittently at first, to allow your feet to acclimate to the support, so now I have a set of used inserts that I would absolutely return if I could. I'm very disappointed and hope that the inserts haven't entirely ruined my new shoes which are now stretched-out in the arch. I'm going to try Spenco Runner/Walker insert and look into returning these Powersteps.

I've had foot pain for almost a year... which was getting worse.  Sounds like it is plantar fasciitis  I figured before I made a trip to the doctor, I'd give this product a shot based on the positive reviews it was getting on Amazon.  I'm on my feet all day, walking at least 4 miles a day... so staying off my feet to let it heal is not an option for me.

The product fit nicely in my shoe, and is pretty comfortable.
Within a week, I noticed the pain was reducing.  It's been almost a month now and the pain is barely in my foot.
This product, as simple as it is, really did live up to the great reviews.

If you are suffering from either heel pain or arch pain, like myself, give these a shot!

I had plantar fasciitis for many months, which was cramping my lifestyle. As treatment, I had several physical therapy sessions, no real help. My doctor prescribed anti-inflammatories and stretching, didn't help much, either. After a week with these shoe inserts, I noticed definite improvement. It's been a little over three weeks now, and the pain is almost completely gone.

I got these insoles based on all the positive reviews.  I used them in my work shoes (Dansko clogs) and they raised my feet so much that it was painful to walk. The tops of my feet were pressed tightly against the top of the shoes. After wearing them for an hour, I could barely walk.

Maybe they would work for someone with "thinner" feet. I would say that my feet are average sized, not super thick or unusually shaped--I buy standard size/width shoes.

I might try them in other shoes but they did not solve my problem of insoles in my work clogs. Bummer.

Perfect dense material - firm heel cup and arch support that an MD would prescribe, yet soft enough.  NOT the squishy trash that you see all day on  t v,  and find in every store, that actually inflames the tissues of your feet.

It is ok I guess but it does not fit most of the shoes I have (eg. converse). It is too wide for most shoes.

Also, after you've inserted the orthotic, you'll have to loosen the shoelace because it takes up quite a lot of room. Also, it will make your feet appears "bigger" and more robust, which is not really pleasant looking (but yea I understand it is not about the look but you know I'm just saying)

Overall, it feels comfortable and does its job.

We spent $35 at the doctors for the identical brand, but actually a cheaper version.  Needing a second pair, and not wanting to fork over another $35, we went on line and found these.  They are great and the price even with shipping was a fraction of what he was charging.  Highly recommend.

I purchased these for my daily shoes in the hopes they would feel good and help with arch support. Unfortunately for me, they did not work and they caused problems in my hip area. I returned them to the company and requested a refund which they sent promptly. So while the product did not work for me the company that makes them stands behind what they sell. So if you are looking for something similar to this the money back guarantee might make it worth it for you to try them out and see if they work for you.
I got them to treat my plantar fasciitis pains that I had for over 6 month and it seem to help a lot. I have high arch and even it's not completely supporting it, it is way better than without them.

Overall, this is a great product on full arch support, especially those who need it for the majority of the foot, who have arch or toe issues.  Yet, every time I put the insert in a shoe, it lifted me too much in the heel that I kept slipping out.  I have small feet and slip out of most shoes anyway.  (And yes, I have tried the fancy lacing in the extra hole at the top of running shoes. It doesn't help.)  The heel cup was designed to grip your heel and keep it in place, but does not work for me. It should if you have a more normal size foot, but don't quote me on that.  Also, this one is more pliable than the original Powerstep insert.  If you need a little give on your insert, this would likely be the better option.
Powerstep pinnacle never let me down. These orthotic insoles are worth every penny you pay for them. They last longer than any I have ever bought in a store and hold up to everyday use.

This product seems durable and well-made.  I am sure that they work great for many people.  However, for others it could cause additional pain.  Before getting these, you should consider seeing a professional.  Wearing orthotic inserts such as these changes the alignment of your feet, ankles, spine, etc, and if these aren't right for you, it could cause you serious problems.

I am an active 24-year old.  I am a nursing student (on my feet for 7+ hours several times a week), I jog, I take my dog on hikes.  I have ridiculously flat feet and have worn the same pair of custom-made orthotics from a podiatrist for almost 10 years, and they have been wonderful.  When my dog chewed them up, I didn't want to  shell out several hundred dollars to go to a podiatrist, so I decided to try these out.  BIG MISTAKE.  I wore them for a few weeks, and experienced slight pain in the evenings.  I figured my feet were just adjusting or I just needed to wear them more (stupid, I know).  Then, a few days ago my back just gave out on me.  I have injured my back by wearing these insoles that are not the right shape for my feet.  Right now I can hardly walk or even sit up without severe pain.  I'll be going to a podiatrist soon for a new pair of custom orthotics.

So, take this as a cautionary tale.  If you have problems with your arches, you should consider seeing a professional before trying a generic product that might cause you more harm than good.  While this product is well-made, it is not for everyone.

I have a high arch and fat feet. Seriously. I know how it sounds.

I use one pair in my work shoes and the other pair in my workout shoes. Both are awesome! My feet feel less tired and achy, and my arches feel fine. One thing I will say is that no foot support will help you if you are on your feet for 4 hours plus without sitting down. Seriously. If you are a nurse, teacher, waiter/tress, retail worker, etc., pair these with compression socks and your life will be easier.

I first ordered these a year ago after the insoles that came with my shoes wore out. They are of fantastic quality, really good arch support. I use them in my running shoes and normal wear around shoes. They work so great, that I just order a second part.

My husband has trouble with his feet.  He had received a pair of these as a gift.  He decided to buy another pair for another pair of shoes.  Works beautifully.  Would recommend this seller and buy again.

I have been very pleased with the Pinnacle Powerstep.  I have been wearing them for over 6 months and they still look and feel new.  Great support and very comfortable right out of the box.  For reference, I have a very narrow foot with a high arch.  I have worn them in several different shoes and they have always felt great.  I would highly recommend!

Got this because of the good reviews and the cost which is about half of the Lynco's I picked up on the internet. My original first thought is that the Powersteps were much stiffer than the Lynco's, but so far there doesn't seem to be any real difference. At any rate, it seems to help me get around on a partially torn achilles until the doctors figure out what to do next.

For about the same price, I prefer the Pinnacle Maxx (other item from the same seller) over the regular Pinnacle inserts. They both have good fit and good comfort, but the Maxx inserts better alleviated my Achilles tendonitis/ plantar fascitis.

I have been having trouble for months with plantar fasciitis, generally worn out feet, and non-localized aching. My orthopedist did not find any torn ligaments, etc. when he x-rayed and recommended $300/each custom orthotics. I decided to try these instead. I was skeptical because I expected the rigid arch to be uncomfortable, but these things feel good and I've been able to wear them to zumba and on walks with no pain. (You remove the in-sole of your athletic shoes and these fit right in.) I will buy another pair since it is inconvenient to move them from one pair to another. I'm very pleased with the product.

The Powestep Pinnacle Orthotic Insert is a geat insert.  It has a strong springy support that is calibrated for comfort.  It provides a heel cradle and it has heat and slip reducing fabric for dryness.  My husband is on his feet all day and swears by this product.

I've been looking for a pair of insoles for my runners with better arch support than the stock ones.  I ordered these but the support seems a little too high for my arches.  Instead of comfortably cradling my arch they sort of jab in making it uncomfortable to run for long periods.  Whats worse is they seem to be uneven.  The one on the left although a bit too high feels relatively balanced while the arch support for the one on the right seems like it's way higher.  I guess this is the downfall of trying one-size-fits-all solutions for footwear.
This product is as good if not better than the more expensive ones you can find in the big box stores

So far the inserts are working very good.  My Dr. wanted approx $700. for custom inserts and a local concern specializing in foot related issues was looking for $350. for inserts.  I think the key is simply building the arch back up and Powerstep at $20. seems to be working.  The key is to always have an insert in place no bare foot activity or you negate the concept.

The Powerstep Pinnacle orthotic insert provides excellent arch support, as well as, extra cushioning for the feet.  The product was recommended to me by my doctor several years ago after I experienced plantar fasciitis.  I have used these orthotics since, and they provide both the comfort and support I need.

These inserts are fantastic. I have had pain in ball of my feet for some years and these inserts maintain my feet in proper alignment and give my arch the support it needs to be pain free. In the beginning, the arch feels a little harsh on my foot but after around 2 or 3 days, the arch softens a bit and my feet feel great. I use them in all my shoes now (hiking boots, athletic shoes and work shoes). They saved my feet!
My husband has been using this product for 2 years. He absolutely loves them. For the price it is a good buy! He stopped complaining of back pain.

The original insole for my boots wore out rather quickly. I needed an aftermarket insert to take it's place and this product has performed great. They are more comfortable than the original insole and I plan on buying a new pair and using them immediatly with my new pair of boots when the time comes.

I damaged ball of my foot (Metatarsalgia) and my podiatrist had recommended this product to me and I have been buying these for several years now. It has made tremendous difference. For me it last for about six to eight months. Really recommend it.

These are kind of wide.  They provide very good support, but because they are so wide I can't use them in my tennis shoes.  They are okay for my walking shoes (old tennis shoes) and makes walking more stable and comfortable.  I use Superfeet for my tennis shoes. They are not as soft but they fit in the shoe well and they also provide very good support.

I have been extremely pleased with the product.  It is one of the most supportive products that I have used.  The last orthotic product that I purchased with very good and got me past my PF. This one is much better and now I am walking 4-5 miles a day using them.  I love them and bought a pair for my wife who has foot problems.  I am so happy to be able to walk again without pain.  I highly recommend them.

Be careful when selecting orthodic inserts. You can permanently damage your foot, knees or back! With that said, these fit my feet well. They are a VERY high, side-biased support. They support the inside of your arch much more than the outside. They raise your arch and cup your heel. They have plastic running down the bottom so they are quite rigid and durable. They are worth the $30!

My original thought was... I've worn out my stock inserts so I need a replacement. The shoes are still good. I had no idea that an insert could make such a huge difference. I run a lot... over 100/week. I spend a lot of time on my feet. I've only used them twice so I'll update this after they're broken in but simply couldn't wait to tout the quality and difference these puppies make.

I have used Super Feet and Dr Scholls brands, even the ones from Sports Authority
They break down over time, decided on these Power Step Pinnacles
Out of the box, you can feel the support, these have a lifetime warranty against cracking which is great
Great product, fit snugly in my shoes after removing the manufacturer spongy insert
I even bought a pair for my slippers for home!
Great product, give stars

I've had pretty severe PF and ball of foot problems (metatarsalis SP?) for about 8 months.  Went to the PT and he told me to get custom orthotics at $400. I did and they helped, but I had to take them back time and time again for adjustments.  I bought these, put them in my cushioned tennis shoes and haven't gone back to the expensive orthotics.  Wear them at work and working out.  They make a lot of difference.

I had continuing debilitating foot pain. I tried the typical inserts but none had an arch support that actually worked with my very high arches. After slipping Powerstep Pinnacle inserts into my shoes, I could walk without pain! I also use them when I run, no pain! I would recommend them to anyone.
These inserts are absolutely amazing! I have very flat feet and bad knees and these are SOO much better than other inserts. I'm buying more!
These arch supports are so good at relieving my heel/foot pain. I haven't found better relief from anything else that I've done.

I usually wear these when I have to be on my feet a long time, or when I go for my daily walks.  They make all the difference in the world.  I swear they even make my knees and back feel better.  I don't get as sore or stiff when I wear them.  I recommend them to everyone.  I got my first pair from a food doctor.  I'm glad that I can order these from amazon anytime I need a replacement!
These inserts give very good arch support.  They seem to be high quality.  My only complaint is that they are fairly thick and may be uncomfortable in tight shoes.

This is very similar to the Powerstep inserts that my foot doctor sold me for $45. The doctors models are called ProTech and have a small pad on each heel. The Pinnacle model are half the price at Amazon and to me just as good.
I had been having some arch pain and these felt great as soon as I stepped into them. They fit very well into my shoe once I took out the insets that were already there.

I have a bad back and knees and very flat feet.  Sadly even new shoes skimp on cushioning and foot support.  A friend recommended the Powerstep Orthotics.  They  provide excellent support at a good price.

when I first purchsed the powerstep pinnacle inserts I was not expecting them to take away the foot pain I was hoping it would cut down the foot pain. Well it was a welcome surprise to be able to wear these inserts everyday with little if any foot pain. I cant say enough about how well they have worked for me. I love them so much I have ordered two more pairs, they are worth every penny.

The Powerstep Pinnacle is very comfortable and gives the support I need, but the lining wears through PREMATURELY on all FOUR pairs in the past year.  Two of the pairs wore through near the ball of foot, one pair the lining tore loose from the side.  On the fourth pair just put into service YESTERDAY, I notice the lining separating from the sides again.  Once the lining has worn through, the foam disintegrates very quickly.

This company either has a manufacturing defect on these insoles, or they lack durability and should be redesigned.  I looking into other brands ... disappointing as they ARE comfortable, but too expensive to have to replace this often.
bought these for my mom. She had severe heel pains for months. Every step takes great effort. She put these in for a day and the pain is significantly reduced. Very happy with the purchase.
This is the 2nd time that I've used this product for plantar fascitis. It helped me immediately after I put it into my shoes. It massages the plantar muscle and the pain was gone in a few days.

For about 1/3 the price of similar inserts from orthopedic doctors Powerstep Pinnacle Orthotic inserts work just fine. I bought a pair for my wife who has flat feet for several years. She is very happy with them and she wanted a couple more. She also tried Powerstep Max inserts but did not like them as much. Note, like shoes, shoe inserts will be worned out over time. They need to be replaced on regular basis depend on how much you use them.

I pair these insoles with my Brooks sneakers and it is the best thing I have tried on my painful feet.  Each time I get new ones takes me a week to get "used" to them.  Mine did not fall apart after months of wear like some people reported.
THESE INSOLES ARE GREAT. THE TOP OF THE LINER ON THE HEEL PART ARE STARTING TO ROLL BACK.GREAT PRICE; I ALSO RECOMMEND THE RED WING HEAT MOLDABLE INSOLES.

I now have several pair of these inserts and will no doubt be getting more!

They turn a good walking shoe into a real fine one. Worth every penny!

This product has made my feet feel so wonderful. They are just what I needed. Hard to put in some shoes because of the shoe style. I would definitely recommend these to anyone who suffers from foot problems. Great price compared to other orthotics.
My pediatrist told me about these shoe inserts and after wearing them for a week, I have noticed less pain in my left foot. This item was delivered on time and in great condition.
Since using the Powerstep Pinnacle I haven't suffered from back or knee pain!  I would definitely recommend this product for anyone who needs arch support.
These are ok but my feet prefer pinnacle max and orange super feet and I work on my feet and have chiropractor orthotics also.
Many size options allowed them to fit in the walking shoes in place of original insole without trimming and helped relieved my heel pain.
Love these insoles
This is at least my 4th pair of Powerstep insoles. The insoles make any running shoe more supportive and lessen the impact of long runs on my feet and shins.
So for this product has helped to reduce the pain under my right foot bottom.  Good for both walking and running shoes.

Received prompty and work great in shoes. They are like the ones I received from doctor's office. Now have extra pairs so that I don't have to switch from one pair of shoes to the next. The price was better, too. I like checking out Amazon.com to get a good deal.

Initially it feels great and fits perfectly if you get order the right size, but in just about 2 weeks i started seeing wear and tear. I am only 180lbs and the 10.5 men sole is no longer usable after 2 weeks,

I purchased these on the recommendation of a podiatrist. At first they hurt my arches, but she told me it would pass. Actually, that was my problem. My arches were too tight, causing a pull on other muscles, etc., causing very painful walking, even limping. These inserts eventually got comfortable and stretched out my arch and made it more flexible. I haven't had the problem since. I also combined this with calf stretches. A lot of sitting, like at a desk, allows the calf muscles to tighen up and pull on the heel, causing heel pain. These really work.

I had pain in left foot arch. I showed it to a few doctors & got the same response it is due to the shoe try changing the sole. I did buy a couple of them & they were only good for a few days then the pain was back.

I was wondering to buy another or forget it but I read the reviews here & thought to give it a try.
In a few days my foot is back to normal I do not have pain in my arch anymore. i am really happy with these.

I will say simply these are the best ones I have got. I recommend to everyone who has got any pain or issues with their current sole try this.
Excellent insert for any type of shoe/sneaker. Great orthotic provides good arch support , cushion and comfort for your feet.

I've used Powerstep orthotics for close to 10 years if not more, and thanks to these inserts I can run for an hour or walk, hike, skate or play tennis for several hours without pain.  I have very flat feet and can't stand barefoot for very long, let alone run, without my feet, legs, hips and back starting to ache.  With the Powersteps in my shoes it's no problem -- the level of support is just right for me.  I've been using the newer Maxx version in my daily-wear shoes, and those are even more comfortable than the regular Pinnacles, but the extra padding might not be a good idea in some cases.  For example, I'll probably keep wearing the regular Pinnacles in my tennis shoes, because they don't slip and the padding is just enough to be comfortable without feeling sloppy or too springy.  Bottom line: I think these are worth a try for anyone with flat feet -- your feet will probably end up thanking you!

I have high arches and recurrent platar fascitis.  These orthotics give very good support in my sneakers and other shoes where I can remove the insoles at a much cheaper price than the podiatrist's $400 pair.  I wouldn't mind if they were even more rigid, actually.

I suffer from heal pain and planter fasciitis / and have naturally high arches. This is my second pair of these insoles and they have greatly improved my comfort and helped releave overall pain. I will continue to use these until I find something better.

They work for me.  I have a continuing PF problem and the Power Steps work for me much better than the softer,
Dr. Scholls types.  They are durable and I have them in all of my shoes.  FYI, I also use the overnight Bird foot brace as well.  Add some daily foot stretching exercise and you can hold PF at bay.
