Great arch support for my plantar ligament.  My feet started feeling better immediately.  Nice to find a product that helped.
Powerstep is giving me the relief I desired and allowing me to walk without some of the pain. It is also much more economical when purchased thru Amazon than some other outlets.
love these arch supports. These are the best arch supports, I liked them better than the custom fitted orthotics made by a podiatrists.
These are great for heel spur sufferers or those who need arch support. I even put them in my water shoes to go to the amusement park!

I haven't used these long enough to tell if they're helping or not, since plantar fasciitis won't go away overnight.  I can say they're comfortable to use in those shoes they do fit in. They're a little too big for most of my shoes, but they fit perfectly into my asics gel. Also, the fabric cover is soft enough to use without wearing socks on other shoes.

So far so good.

These inserts are great!  The price is cheap compared to pharmacy prices.  I bought a pair for myself and love them, I also bought a pair for my 13 year old daughter who has heal pain from plantar fasciitis. They cured her pain in a few days. This was a very good buy. I will purchase more in the future.

I have worn these for years... and they are, hands down, the best!  Excellent support for arches and for walking or running.  I often take a pair with me when I go to purchase running shoes... because they sometimes work best with a size (or so) larger.  These cost a lot less than professionally contoured inserts that cost a whole lot more! They are rugged and maintain their support!

I got these and a pair of Superfeet Black about a month ago for my SO after reading through hundreds of reviews here at amazon and also at zappos. He is 55, has very flat feet and suffers from what he calls "hot heels." In his work he attends numerous trade shows and after a day on concrete flooring he is in intense pain.

He was immediately attracted to the heel cushioning aspect of the Powerstep Pinnacles and went on to wear them for a couple of hours a day for several days. He said that they began alleviating his pain almost immediately. He felt the insoles repositioning his feet during the break in period and used that to guide him as to how long to wear them before taking a break. In any case, they've been show-tested and although he is not pain free he finds them very helpful and I am going to get him several more pairs here at amazon for distribution throughout his flock of footwear. If I were going to buy one pair only I probably would get them on ebay where several vendors offer them for about the same money with free shipping.

He typically wears Merrells, boots and outdoor sport type shoes, in a 10-10.5-11 size range. Swapping out the Merrell insoles with a pair of 10-10.5 size G Powerstep Pinnacles was simple and easy and did not require altering the insoles in any way.

Regarding the Superfeet Black, he did try them out. They are currently installed in a pair of his Merrell Chameleon mid height boots, which I notice he's not been wearing.  When I asked him about the Superfeet he told me that because the Superfeet do not have the immediate cushioned feel of the Powersteps he doesn't feel inclined to persist with them. Now I just spent several minutes examining the two pairs of boots housing the new insoles and, to me, although the Superfeet are overtly sans cushion there really isn't a whole lot of what I would call cushioning in the Powersteps either. But apparently it makes all the difference for him.

I wanna say that I am profoundly grateful for all of the information freely available from the amazon community in these reviews. You folks surely are a generous bunch and I continue to be amazed by and very thankful for you.

I personally think that these insoles are far better than the ones that are offered in stores (gel insoles).  For one main reason, they don't move around in the shoe which causes you to take your shoe off to re-adjust the insole back into place.  Plus, they seem to provide more comfort to the feet all together, not just to the heel of the foot.  If you want to try something that gives you more comfort for your feet and will stay in place.  Or, if you're just tired of the other insoles not working like they use to, buy these, they work.

I have been using these inserts for the last two weeks.  I am very impressed.  They work amazingly well to combat leg and foot fatigue.  I work in the plastic injection industry and I do machine installations where I am standing on concrete 8-12 hours per day.  I can't say that I am not tired at the end of the day, but there is a huge difference between the Pinnacle inserts and the stock inserts that came with my safety shoes.  They really are effective.  I will be buying them again, when this pair needs replacing.

I have post tibial tendonitis. My foot Dr sold the same insoles to me for 50.00!!
They work great and at this cost im buying more for other shoes!!

Upon recommendation of my podiatrist, I ordered these inserts.  They are amazing and priced at half what they wanted for the same inserts at my doctor's office.  They are very durable, fit my shoes perfectly, and will help you tremendously if you have high arches and suffer with foot problems.
Powerstep Pinnacle Inserts I bought through Amazon.com make my walking a lot easier,  I am very pleased with them they FIT just fine.

I'm flat footed and have tried dozens of insoles to save my feet from working on concrete all day.  Previously the only thing that worked was Brooks Addiction shoes.  Lately, money being short I decided to try a bargain pair of shoes and take a chance on these insoles.  At first it felt like a huge rock in my shoe and I thought I made a huge mistake.  Remarkably, after a few days, all the pain went away and I can work all day without any foot pain.

These really have improved my foot comfort; I walk on cement all day and have been buying everything I can find for the last 7 years to make my feet ache a little less.  This product was really good; not excellant, but really good.

I had tried several different shoe inserts in hopes of getting relief from my plantar fascitis, but nothing seemed to help until I purchased a set of Powerstep Pinnacle Orthotic Inserts.  While they have not eliminated all the pain and discomfort, the improvement has been dramatic.

I'm a cook, so I regularly am on my feet for 8 hours at a time. These things are fantastic. I had Dr. Scholls, which are pretty comfortable, but as far as support goes, these are much better. For an everyday pair of shoes, the Dr. Scholls actually feel better, but for marathon sessions at work, the hard and firm powersteps are great for keeping me from being in pain. I would highly recommend them.

These are really great. I had non-stop arch pain in my feet. None of the cheapies worked at all. I bought a pair of these for my everyday shoes. The helped my feet so much I bought a pair for my work shoes and recommend them to everyone!

I developed plantar fasciitis (sp?) from standing on concrete 40 hrs a week for 15 years, and had to find something to help with the pain. These fit well in all of my tennis shoes that have removable inserts (most brand names), and into my leather slip-ons as well. They have a very high arch, which is what I need. They saved me hundreds because I didn't have to buy all new shoes, too!

I have been wearing/using these for years, glad they finally made them with a litte cushion. My foot doc. thought they were fine, but felt I needed more suport.(Think he just wanted to make some bucks) He had a pair made for me I use them in my primary work shoes, but most women have more than one pair of shoes, so I purchase these for my other shoes instead of switching out all the time.
Give them a try, I think they are great!

I was having pain in my knee and turns out I had Runner's Knee. I bought these to help relieve the pain and I've been using them for a little over a month and my knee pain has definitely improved. I still have a little after I run, but these things have helped. I'm also doing Terminal Extension exercies to help strenghten the muscles around my knees. To help them last longer, I keep them in my running sneakers and only where them to run.

Also, my Reebok sneakers are a size 7 and I got the 6-6.5 size and they fit in my sneakers perfectly. However, they don't fit in my size 7 New Balances.

These insoles are better than my insoles specially design by a medical professional that cost $200.  I have Planar fasciitis and these insoles really help. At first they seem to be to high an arch, but I have learned that that is what I need to eliminate the pain in my heel.  They do however have to be replaced about every 4-6 months as they develop wear spots.

The Pinnacle arch supports are the best I've found.  I have ordered enough so I don't have to trade between shoes.

Thanks.

I've tried a bunch of inserts, and these are the best ones you can get outside of a professionally molded / custom-made one from your podiatrist.  The arch support, the most important part whether you're flat-footed or have high arches, is super firm and won't bend.  I'm a powerlifter and weigh 265 pounds, and if they can keep my flat-arches from flattening out even more, they'll most probably work great for you as well!

The powerstep pinnacle show inserts are great. When wearing them for the first time was a little uncomfortable for my left foot issue, but after getting use to wearing them, I will be purchasing another pair.

These insoles really work!! I had a pair before from my foot but it had been a while and in order to get new ones they wanted me to come in. Didnt want to pay the Copay and the cost for the insoles. I was so happy that amazon had them! I have very flat feet and normally when I am doing exercises my arches start to hurt within 15-20 min of classes. I had these on and my feet where great! The only thing that was killing me in exercise class was the instructor!! they absolutely work and are definitely better than any dr scholls product

I work on a nursing unit and am on my feet a lot.  I bought these to replace my olds orthotics that are over 2 years old.  I've not had any specific foot or back problems, and am an athlete, so no specific need for orthotics other than comfort.  I found that my old orthotics from the Walking Company were more "comfy" with more padding, but were about 70 dollars, whereas these were about $20.  These are a phenominal value, and in the last week I have owned them seem to be doing their job.  I recommend trying them out.

I purchased these insoles with the idea that I could add support to my arches. Also, I needed support when working my lower body in the gym.
During workouts I would experience knee pain when doing leg presses, because of the alignment of my flat feet. At first, I was not happy with the soles, because I didn't allow for a "break-in" period. Anyway, I pressed through wearing them for 2 days straight and then took a break from them for 4 days. When I finnally, put them in my gym shoes during my lower body workout the difference was amazing. All of knee pain was gone. I had better balanace and every movement I made felt right. I have been looking for good insoles for years and these are perfect for me.

I've had pain in my heel for the last 3 or 4 months. Instead of getting better it was getting worse. It doesn't help that I'm on my feet for a large portion of the day. The very first day I wore these I was pain free the entire day.

I'm very glad I purchased these and will recommend them to anyone I know who has pain in their feet.  Very happy!
These arrived so quickly and were priced very reasonably.  Came highly recommended by my podiatrist.  Transaction went smoothly and I am a satisfied customer !

These are by far the best foot supports I've found,but they don't hold up. They are comfortable, but the top lining separates from the foam in a matter of 2-3 monthes. I still buy them because they do wonders for my feet,I just wish they would fix this problem.

This offers more support than any non-prescription insole!  It feels almost like a $400 podiatrist orthotic for a mere $25.  Unlike Superfeet this is a real cushion built into a firm mold.  It has a lot of cushion.  The only downside is this thing is very thick and has no air holes- so it can be a lot of trouble getting in dress shoes and tends to make your feet feel hot by leaving little space for airflow and a lot of hot manmade materials which trap air.
Otherwise this thing is quite comfortable.

Very happy. Saved my feet from additional damage from running. Now i can run with little or no pain and recover in 24 hours or less and ready to run again. When I purchases I could not see how an insole could make that much diference. Beleve me it does. I wish I had two pair for other shoes other then running shoes. One thing to note: Make sure your existing insole will come out of your shoe, if not make sure you have enough room in the shoe to add the insole. also happy with shipping, delivery and vendor of the product.

I have used the regular Powerstep inserts and these Powerstep Pinnacle inserts.  I prefer the extra padding on the Pinnacles.  My wife prefers the 3/4 length but I will stick with the full length ones.  I have used these for years and they completely relieve my Plantar Fasciitis pain.  I get at least a  year of wear or more from every pair.  I usually have 2-3 pair of Pinnacles so I can keep them in boots, sneakers, and work shoes.  Great price and value here on Amazon.  Highly recommend.

I went to a podiatrist for chronic pain with my feet. She diagnosed me with 'over pronation' and prescribed custom orthotics but also gave me a set of these insoles until I could get the custom ones.

I have tried MANY over-the-counter insoles and find the Prowetstep to be the best so far. For me, all the others are junk compared to these. I actually like these better then my custom orthotics!

This is just my experience. Contact your medical professional for proper diagnosis and treatment.

I love these.  I was recently diagnosed with plantar faciitis and had to get orthotics from the foot doctor at a cost of over $40.  These are made by the same company and cheap enough that I ordered a couple pair so I can put them in my slippers and sneakers and not have to bother with changing one pair back and forth.  My feet feel great and I will probably be able to forgo surgery now.

Just the right amount of arch support (and I have a high arch)as well as padding.  Recommended by my podiatrist when I began suffering from swelling in the balls of my feet.  Fit into my Easy Spirits with ease (also recommended by my podiatrist).

Takes a lot of pressure off the back.  Didn't expect to see such a change.

These help the pain of my Plantar Fasciitis, but don't eliminate it entirely.  Of course, of all the treatments I've tried (night splints, cortisone shots, rest, ice, immobilization, stretching, etc.) this helped better than anything.  It makes the day bearable instead of miserable. I can still walk at the end of a day, which is more than I could say before.

I find I have to replace them a few times a year, and I always move the old sets to less frequently used shoes, like slippers and such.  If they're too big, especially in the toe area, I cut them right in front of the hard plastic part to make them about half the length (especially true if I can't get the old insole out of the shoe without tearing it up).  This gives a little more room and actually lowers the front of the foot slightly, making a little more support in the middle.

I've heard that these are just as good as medical orthotics, and from talking to people who have those, they aren't getting any more relief than I am, so I feel these are worth it.  I've bought several pair, and plan to continue using them as long as I have foot pain.

I have used the Original Powerstep inserts with much success, so thought these would be even better: wrong. The arch seems overly high and stiff, and they make the bottom of my foot sore (almost as if it's cramping up) if I wear them for more than just short periods.

What an amazing value. I was so surprised by the quality of the construction and durability. I suffer from high arches, plantar fasciitis, and heel pain. The supports are very sturdy but I did not experience and "breaking in" pain. They performed well from day 1. At the same time I purchased a new pair of skechers Skechers Women's Premium SneakerI removed the factory insert the shoes came with and slid the powersteps right in and they fit perfectly. What a perfect combination for happy nurse feet.

My heel was sensitive and painful each time I got out of bed, stoodup, or walked. A friend mentioned he had damaged his plantar fascia several years prior, which caused him pain just like I had described.  In early April of this year 2010, from daily walking on gravel where I work here in Afghanistan, I figured I must have damaged my plantar fascia.  The pain in the heel of my right foot got worst with each passing day.  Not having immediate access to a foot specialist, I contacted one in Doha, Qatar, who reccommended I search the internet for a 'Powerstep' orthotic insert to use until I returned to the states.  Searching the internet revealed several locations for the same insert with varied prices. I purchased a pair for under $25 ( I would have paid more), and they arrived in less than 10 days...I was desperate, as walking and standing had become almost un-bearable for me.  Those things worked like magic (they instantly became worth a lot more to me).  In fact, they had me feeling so much better that I went back on-line after a few days and tried ordering four additional pairs to put in my other shoes.  I only found one more pair for under $25, so I purchased it as a back-up until I can get a custom fitting.  My feet feel ssoooooo good.  This product probably saved my job, and, prevented future aches and pains from me over-compensating because of the constant pain I was having to deal with whenever I stood or walked.  Running was out of the question.  I love my Powerstep Pinnacle Orthotic Inserts.  Thank you, Thank you, Thank you.  (The plantar fascia is the thick connective tissue which supports the arch of the foot. It runs from the tuberosity of the calcaneus forward to the heads of the metatarsal bones. It is the source of the painful condition which I know about first-hand.)

These Powerstep Pinnacale inserts have eliminated my heal pain and I have come back to order two more pairs. I use them in all my shoes that have removable insoles and am living pain free! I have recommended them to all my friends and family. That extra arch support and heel cup really make all the difference in having shoe comfort, a worthy investment.

My doctor recommended Powerstep Pros about a year ago, and I now own 3 pairs. This was my first try with the Pinnacles. These are almost the same as the pros, but slightly lower quality. Still relieves the pain and works WAY better than any other OTC orthotic, but if you can find the PowerStep Pro, it is worth the extra few dollars.
I play tennis and racquetball and have been having plantar fasciitis pain. Recommended by my physical therapist. Got immediate relief.  Worked so well I bought a second pair.

I purchased two pairs of these orthotics for my husband and adult son who are both flat footed.  My husband's podiatrist actually recommended these inserts to improve an issue he was having with his ankle joints sagging due to his overpronation.  These immediately reduced his ankle pain and swelling and with regular use have corrected it.  My son had a similar problem with his knee due to his flat feet and these completely cured the problem.  Amazon offered these orthotics for more than $10 less than offered at our local store.  I always check out Amazon first whenever I need ANYTHING and I am never disappointed!
I have diabetes and must be extremely careful about my feet.  These inserts provide exceptional support and are extremely comfortable.

I have spent YEARS looking for a good pair of orthotics. I have tried almost every Dr. Scholls product and some of the drugstore brands. Some worked ok..others failed miserably. Others did not provide enough support, slid around in my shoes, or were just plain uncomfortable. These orthotics are what I have been looking for this whole time.

I have flat feet and spend most of my day on them (about 6 hours or so at work, plus plenty of time at home). When I first got these orthotics, I did follow the directions and only wore them for a few hours at a time to get used to them. After the first few times wearing them, I was not very impressed. They were a little uncomfortable and I felt the arches might be too far forward in my shoe. However, after continuing to break them in, my opinion changed drastically. I now wear these exclusively and have stopped using my other orthotics. In fact, I wore a pair of older ones and my feet hurt instantly. I had to switch to these immediately.

A couple tips for people wearing them the first time:

- Gradually break them in for a few hours a day for at least a few days. Increase the wearing time little by little.

- Be patient when making your judgment on these until after you wear them for at least a few full days.

- Some shoes might require the insoles being removed (most of mine did not however).

- These work really well for wide feet (they do not slide around like smaller and cheaper models; this alone is reason enough to get them for me!)

I will be purchasing another pair or two so I can don't have to keep switching them out every day. These are definitely worth the investment, and are inexpensive enough that if they don't work for you, it is not a huge financial loss. (Not to mention, Amazon returns are so quick and easy)

UPDATE - 2/11 - I have been wearing these EVERY DAY since I broke them in..a little more than two months. I have since gotten rid of the rest of my old insoles and have ordered another pair of these. My feet have never been more comfortable in years!! Since I wear a different pair of shoes to work almost every day, they have started to show some wear and tear around the edges. I would recommend getting a few pairs to minimize this damage. I will continue to update and hopefully be able to offer some positive feedback in regards to longevity.

UPDATE - 9/9 - After using these exclusively for 10 months, I have to replace a pair. The area where my "big" toe sits has worn straight through the pad and down to the hard plastic. This has created a strange feeling and makes them less comfortable to wear. My other pair is still in great shape. Not sure if it makes a difference, but the insoles that must be replaced stayed in my sneakers the entire time. The other pair I rotate into my dress shoes for work each day and other pairs of sneakers. Perhaps rotating them helps them air out and prevent deterioration?

Recommended by my local foot specialist, these inserts really help in my battle with plantar fasciatis. You may have to get accustomed to them by wearing them only a few hours at a time at first. Need to replace them at least every 6 months. But, they really do the trick. I put them in all my shoes, replacing the original liner. I have flat feet.

I liked these inserts so much, I bought a second pair.  A good pair of shears or a knife to trim them to fit, and you're good to go.  For lightweight shoes (read little support) these inserts are wonderful.  In heavier shoes these orthotic supports feel good and work well too.  These are much better than what typically comes in a new pair of shoes and well worth the additional investment.

the inserts are not the ones sold in the major chain stores. These are much better and give more support. I can say from a person who stands on a concrete floor for long periods of time, these are well worth the money.

This was my  first time wearing orthotics so I didn't know what to expect. The insoles did feel a bit "hard" on my feet at first but I got used to them after a week of wearing them. Insoles fit perfectly in my shoes. Not to thin. Not too thick. Comfortable after you get used to them. Overall, it's a good product.

I ordered the Powerstep Pinnacle insole (M6.5/W8-8.5)to put into new size 8 Crocs that didn't have any arch support. They fit perfectly and feel wonderful. Great arch support and very cushioned. Wish I'd had these years ago.

I first purchased a couple of pairs of these inserts from my podiatrist about 5 years ago.  They were over $30 each, much more than they cost at Amazon.  Have had them for a week only thus far, but they seem to be the same orthodics and I expect the same quality of arch support.

These things give really solid support for high arches.  They do not resist odor that well.  I put them in my work shoes and noticed about 2 months into using them.  I do not normally have an odor problem with my feet, so I am going out on a limb when I say it's gotta be the insoles.

I used these for 1.5 months before the top fabric liner began to fall off.  I contacted the manufacture of the product and they replaced them for free (I paid to ship the defective ones back).  The manufacture said they have been getting complaints of the liner failing recently.  My second pair is also already beginning to fail after only a few weeks.  They are very comfortable but just unusable when the top liner falls off and balls up under your heels.  I will attempt to repair my second pair with glue, but i would certainly not buy these again.

Purchased Powerstep Pinnacle for my 11 year old son who was experiencing heal pain after playing soccer.  He has flat feet.  After using the Powersteps for three weeks, he is not experiencing any more heal pain after he plays.

I have worn most all of the incerts for shoes . I have had both feet operated on and had custom incerts made for my shoes . After the two hundred dollar incerts wore out I went to these . They are the best on the market .
I have bought inserts from podiatrists for a lot of money (for plantar faciiitis) that don't fit or work as well as this. I'll probably get another pair.

These are comfortable for walking and running straight ahead but they don't provide enough support for flat feet and pronated ankles. Also, the cover is too slippery to play tennis in and so I slide around in them which is not comfortable.
Tried custom orthotics before, but switched to the Powerstep Pinnacle inserts.  I'm a fairly large person at 6'4" 240, but these provide plenty of support and comfort for the shoes I wear to the gym.

These orthotics have completely resolved my plantar fasciitis. They aren't the first I have tried because I have had this condition for years. I appreciate the quality and price. I was thrilled to get them so fast.

I am in a lot of pain due to plantar fasciitis. The podiatrist tried to sell me the exact same insole for $10 more than the price on amazon. The arch support is really good because the arch area is very stiff on the insole. I can actually feel the arch support with these things in my shoes. Never felt that with any of the dr. scholls insoles I tried, and I tried a lot of them.
I returned these. I have very flat feet and the angle on which these are designed didn't work for me. They seem to be very well made and I cannot give them a bad rating.
this has got to be the best $24.59 i've ever spent. after using it for one day, my feet no longer hurts.... getting 2 more pairs for my other shoes.

I don't buy anything anymore without first checking the reviews here on Amazon.  The reviews did not let me down.  These REALLY saved me during a recent reinjury of Plantar Fasciitis in my left foot.  While the arch support was just a little more than my foot needed, they did immediately take the pressure off and allow me to begin walking normally again.  My arch is a normal height and feet are otherwise healthy.  I really liked the extra padding in the Pinnacle.  It makes them more comfortable to wear.  The orthotic support is sandwiched between two layers of padding for that extra cushioning, unlike some of the other brands with only one layer of padding.  They also seem to be VERY well made.  This is why I gave them 5 stars.  I highly recommend them!

Note: These are designed for use in shoes with more room inside, like tennis shoes where you can loosen the laces a little if needed.  You will want to remove the existing insole before putting the Pinnacles in.  If you want a thinner pair for dress shoes or some casual shoes, Powerstep also makes an Original and a Slim Step 3/4 design that will fit shoes with less room inside.

The powerstep Pinnacle was the right combination of orthotic support and padding to get me on my feet again.  I'll retire these as soon as my foot heals and go back to regular insoles like the Spenco Polysorbs.  I just bought a pair of the Walk/Runner for my tennis shoes and a pair of the Cross Trainer for my casual shoes.  The Cross Trainer is thinner than the Walk/Runner and are easier to fit in casual shoes.  Both Spenco insoles have some arch support, but are not orthotics and do not provide as much support as the Powerstep line.

On the negative, the arch support in the Pinnacle Powerstep was just a little higher/more substantial than what I needed to properly fit my feet.  On the positive, Not only did they immediately allow me to start walking again, the shape fit my shoes better than the Spencos do.  If I ever hurt my foot again, I might try something different like the Spenco RX Orthotics instead.  They say the Spencos can be molded to fit your feet which may solve my (very minor) arch support complaint.  Since I haven't tried the Spenco Orthotics, I don't know if they would be better, the same or worse.  I also don't know if the Spenco RX Orthotics are padded as well as the Powerstep Pinnacles.  It's just when your foot hurts THAT BAD, you'll do ANYTHING to make it feel better.

One big lesson I learned from this is to always have a good pair of insoles in my shoes when doing anything physical - and to replace them at least once a year.  Shoes and insoles DO wear out.  Your feet (at least my feet do) need the extra support & cushioning of a good pair of insoles.  I hurt my foot while wearing an old pair of tennis shoes with worn out insoles that had no padding left.  I believe that if I was wearing a recent pair of the Spenco insoles in those shoes, I would not have injured my foot.

I know I'm reviewing a little more than just than just the Powerstep Pinacles here.  Given the amount of pain associated with this type of injury, I though a bit of a conversation would be more productive.  Good luck with your feet!

I have $500 prescription orthotics from my Dr. for the past 1-1/2 years. They are worn out,so I tried these and was amazed that they were just as supportive and more comfortable than my prescription orthotics. It was a no brainer for me. I bought 2 more pairs for my other shoes and sneakers. Three pairs for $80 dollars! Amazing!!!

Hey all,
I have played sports my entire life and over the last few years I have had heel and back pain, I went to a podiatrist and he wanted to make me a set of custom orthotics, which would have been great, except for the price of $400!! And this is with no guarantees,insurance typically does not cover this.. So being a person that likes to check around I found a shoe repair guy that actually used to make these custom orthotics for the podiatrists and he recommended the pinnacle powerstep and I will tell you that it works great!! I play basketball 2-3 a week and I can really feel the difference no more heel or back pain.. I highly recommend this product...
Excellent quality recommended by my podiatrist for plantar fasciitis and heel spur.  Was too tight of a fit to put in my dress shoe.  Unfortunately will have to return one.

I developed pain in my left heel last year after changing to different walking shoes.  They had less heel cushioning.  I never had problems before.  I changed back to walking shoes and also hiking boots with more heel cushioning and support.  Between those and judicious reduction of my daily 1-hour walks, I finally got back to normal after six months of pain.  I was about ready to schedule a Dr. appointment.

While researching heel pain, I came across many positive reviews about PowerSteps.  I have never worn inserts before.  I bought a pair of the Pinnacles.  Based on reviews, I was concerned these might have too high an arch compared to Originals.  (But, they have a 30-day satisfaction guarantee.)  I have fairly low arches.  They were fine-very comfortable and supportive.  I wish I had learned of these sooner.  I may not have suffered as long.  My lower back feels better after my long walks too.

Call me a satisfied customer.  I bought three more pairs for my other shoes and one for my wife.
This insole does a good job in supporting the foot, but the pro model also offers gel cushion for the heal which is what I needed. Still, if you don't need that, this is a good insole.
Very good arch support - helped me ease the heel pain associated with Plantar Fascitis. Keep in mind that they are a bit on a thicker side, but overall they are excellent.

I've had plantar fasciitis for several months now. I bought these because they were rated very high by other sufferers. I guess I was expecting these insoles to cure the problem, which might've been too much to ask.

First, let me say they have great heel cushion. They slid into my sneaker very easily, and after a few steps, I could tell the shock absorption was much better than what I'd been using.

I kept the exercise easy, walking the dog around the neighborhood. I still had pain, but it was not as bad. I figured the pain would take a few days to go away.

It didn't. I still have pain, which is why I rated this 4 stars. I stretch every morning, several times during the day, I ice it, I take ibuprofen, I massage it, I do strengthening exercises...I thought shoe inserts would be the thing I needed to get rid of plantar fasciitis once and for all. It helped dull the pain a little more, but these aren't a cure.

I think the problem is I need more arch support. One reviewer recommend hard foam in addition to these inserts. I agree with that. I fold a paper towel, shape it to my arch, then tape it into my shoe. That seems to be working in combination with all the stretching and icing. Still, I think an insert should provide more arch support than this one does.
great instep
I had planter fasciitis the doctor gave me a shot in my foot. After, that she recommended insert from powerstep. They work great on my feet. Now,I got comfort to the max.

It was time to replace the dogs playground so out with the old insoles and in with the new. I replaced a pair that cost more than twice what these did and I cant really tell a difference between the two. They are very comfortable and I am using them in a pair of Dr Martins I use for work. My wife would love it if they would soak up all the foot odor but then what would she have to complain about. Just kidding.

These orthotics saved me from having to spend hundreds of dollars on custom made orthotics.  I have no more pain from plantar fascitis and I buy new ones every year tokeep me pain free and walking frequently!

The Powerstep Pinnacle Orthotic Insert fit immediately, without trimming, and was comnfortable to the foot right from the start.  My only critisism would be that it cost more than what I paid the last time I bought the product in a sports store.

I developed plantar fasciitis a couple of months ago and these inserts were recommended by some pro runners at Fleet Feet--local athletic store. The inserts provide great support and have really cut down on the pain I've experience in the past.  I also tape my heel, which I'm sure cuts down on the pressure that is applied to my heel.
I would recommend these inserts to anyone who has problems with plantar fasciitis.

PS--Great customer service.  I had a question about my purchase and they got back to me very quickly.  Fast shipping too!

Several years ago I went to a kinetic conditioning center for my knee.  I also have foot problems.  He recommended getting a good running shoe and replacing the insole with these.  It has made a world of difference.  I tried different brands of insoles, but none work as well for me.

I was told about this product in a foot store and decided to try it.  What a change.  For over a year the arthritis in my feet has caused me a great deal of pain, not only when I walk but even after taking off my shoes to relax.  This product has made a world of difference.  My feet do not hurt when I have these in my shoes.  I have to take out the inserts that came with the shoe, replace with this, and my feet don't hurt.  I use it in my saucony, nike and adidas shoes.  It is much better than some of the cheaper versions I have tried and since then I have bought two more pairs so I don't have to change every time I put on another pair of shoes.

I have struggled for nearly a year with planar faciitis.  Mostly what irritates it is playing/coaching soccer.  My massage therapist suggested these inserts after I had tried several other items and techniques including but not limited to an elastic band for the arch, sleeping in the boot (that did help but did not eliminate it), etc.  Though at the start of a run my arches can get a fatigued feeling early when using the inserts, it eventually goes away and I feel no arch pain after my activity.  I have since bought 5 more pairs for every pair of shoes I wear.  They work best when you take the original insole out.

These have helped my knee pain by giving me proper arch support.  My only concern is that they just aren't wide enough for some of my sneakers.  I even ordered up a size thinking it would help, but it didn't.  If you have a narrow or normal width foot, you should be great.

I have used the Powerstep orthotics for years and am very pleased with them. I have very flat feet and my ankles are due for replacement or fusion. I have tried other orthotics but I always return to Powerstep.

My tennis instructor recommended this product to combat chronic plantar fasciitis.  It provided almost immediate relief from the pain.  I wear them virtually all day (one set for work shoes & one set for sneakers).  The price is significantly lower than other orthodics.
These are an excellent choice for those of us who may not want to spend several hundred for a pair of custom orthotics. I have a pair in every pair of shoes I own for convenience.

I have used several over the counter supports and have found the powerstep to be the most effective. I have heel a heel spur which had been giving me fits. With time and routine use symptoms have greatley been reduced. Definetly worth a try.
Great for Plantar Faciitus! Take some getting use to though and will take a week or two to feel effects. I use them exclusively in my slippers when in the house.

It used to take my legs about a week to recover from a long distance run (half marathon, or even a 10K). I just ran a 10 Miles last saturday morning wearing these insoles for the first time. Besides feeling stable and secure while running, I had no soreness whatsoever after the race. I LOVE this things, I'm 28 and have been wearing insoles for my flat feet since I can remember, spendig hundres looking for the perfect fit. Well I found it and I love it. They are a little pricey at the local shop, so after buying two pairs from them I opted for Amazon, you can't beat this price...

The other reviewer is correct re. these being too thick for some shoes (boat shoes and some others). However, they provide truly outstanding support for those with medium to high arches (I have high arches)!!  I hit the gym 6 times a week and these are great for running or elliptical exercise.  HIGHLY recommend them.  They are well made and offer firm arch support, love em.

Having tried all the drugstore arch supports and other online varieties, the Powerstep and the Powerstep Pinnacle are excellent products and clearly the best I have encountered.  Not only are they effective, but they are also comfortable.

I have a high arch and was concerned at first that the arch in the Powerstep was not high enough to provide the benefits I needed, because some other medium-height supports did not help me.  This turned out not to be a problem.  After wearing the Powerstep for just a couple of days my heel problems were gone and my feet and knees felt well.  Apparently the shape of the support is just right to provide the benefit.

(Incidentally, my main problem has been heel spurs.  An insightful doctor told me that they would stop hurting after using arch supports for a couple of months.  He was right!  Heel cushions are not the solution - arch supports are.)

I  have also used the Powerstep basic model, which is the same orthotic but without the additional padding.  The Pinnacle is slightly more comfortable because of its softness.  However, because of its additional thickness it fits in only one of my pairs of shoes, while the basic model fits in nearly all of them.  If in doubt, buy the basic Powersteps, not the Powerstep Pinnacles.

The orthics are made of high quality plastic, which have lasted me for several months so far.  They are not as rigid and strong as the $300 variety, but I think that for the price they are reasonably sturdy.

For several years I've looked for supportive and comfortable arch supports, and now that I've found the Powersteps I plan to stick with them.  I recommend them highly.

This is the second pair I've had in the past year.  Although the box says lifetime warrantee, that's not true.  However, my first pair did last an entire year.

Custom made orthotics, as you know, are supremely expensive.  I cannot imagine how much better $300.00 custom made orthotics are compared to these that I just bought for $30.00 here at Amazon.com.  They are that good!

The local store where I bought these last year charged me $50.00 plus the exhorbitant CA plus LA County sales taxes, which totals to be the highest in the entire United States now.

I briefly scanned some of the other reviews and one thing did stand out for me: there is a break in time period before you can wear these constantly without any foot pain.  But, once they are broken in for you particular feet and shoes, like me, you will fall in love with this product, no joke!

Although these can be worn in any shoes you have, I have found that using one pair per pair of different shoes helps me the best.

I use these with the black leather Brooks Addiction Walker shoes, which are $100.00 here on Amazon, so I will be buyting those, too, from Amazon in the future.  The first two (2) pairs I purchased were bought locally for $120.00 plus the aforementioned sky high sales tax.

These Brooks have lasted me an entire year, as well.  I bought a new pair about two weeks ago and then found the Pinnacle orthotics here at Amazon for only $30.00, full price, delivered to my door.

After putting the new pair in my new pair of Brooks shoes and walking around for a little while, I remembered why the break in period is needed.

I have tried numerous over the counter orthotics, and these Pinnacles are by far the absolute best ones, bar none.

Note: I wanted to try out the new Dr. Scholl's that are being advertised.  I found them along with the machine that's supposed to accurately tell you which model is going to help you the most at a CVS.  1) They cost $50.00 plus tax; 2) I had to use the Dr. Scholl's machine numerous times to get a Dx for the model that is supposed to be the best for my feet (get the message?).  The manner in which the Dr. Scholl's are packaged is extremely restrictive.  They are packaged in very hard plastic with a very small hole with which to be able to stick your finger in it to feel them, etc., without opening the package just to check them out, which you cannot do because that is considered theft.  Also, from what I could determine, there is zero toe support in the Dr. Scholl's orthotics.

Anyhow, I've digressed.  Without any hesitation whatsoever, I wholeheartedly recommend the pinnacle orthotics without any reservations whatsoever.  They are excellent and have helped me tremendously.

Just a note regarding shoes: I wanted to try the rocker walking shoes, you know, the ones that cost about $250.00 per pair.  I cannot wear any of the brands because my right heel is too narrow and they feel like thongs when I try to walk in them (a bummer for me).  Although I'm not rating the above noted Brooks shoes because it will be my next pair that I purchase from Amazon, for me, combined with the ortotics I am rating, I have not found any better combination of shoes + orthotics!

Lastly, I emphatically note that I have absolutely zero connection in any manner with Brooks or Pinnacle.

This combination of products, for me, has tremendously helped my lousy posture as well as pain due to medical conditions I shall not disclose.

Oh yeah, it looks like this review is only for the size I wear, but my review holds true for any size of these.
Happy with product
I now have 4 sets of these, distributed among various shoes. Really helps alleviate the plantar fasciitis (heal pain that for me came from running).
I was having significant heel pain (probably the onset of plantar fasciitis) and after using the Pinnacle Orthotics I have no more pain.  Great stuff!!!!

I have been suffering from plantar fasciitis, after a small research I found out that these insoles are the best and they were right! first day it felt weird (I have flat feet) but after that we became inseparable! The moment I forget to put them in my shoes I feel uncomfortable. I love them, I would get another pair if I need again.

I've worn the Powerstep insoles for about three years, since recommended by a podiatrist friend to help with my plantar fasciitis.  They helped in a very short time.  They feel quite odd and hard for the first day or two, but then I didn't want to be without them and could walk or stand for MUCH longer MUCH more comfortably than before.  I decided to try the Powerstep Pinnacles this time.  While I like them much better than not having them in my shoes, I think I'll stick with the slightly less expensive regular Powerstep in the future.  These seem like they'd be more comfortable (there's more cushion in the heel), but I find my feet to be sore sooner than with a new set of the regular Powerstep.
These insoles took the pain away from my feet due to Plantar Fascitis. They fit my shoes without having to modify them. Once these wear out I will definitely purchase them again.

I have tried others products and when my local running store suggested the Pinnacle, I switched to check them out. A week later I ran a Half-Marathon race (2nd in age-group)  with them in my running shoes. My feet problems did not surface either then nor during the sixty mile weeks subsequent to that. I weigh 167. I usually train in "Asics GEL-Kayano 14" and have high arches.

I am now back here to buy two additional pairs so that I can add them to my regular shoes.

I have so far purchased 3 pair of these orthotics along with a pair from the podiatrist for $400. I don't even wear the $400 ones anymore because ther hurt my feet, so don't waste your $$$, buy these.
Received product as expected within the allotted shipping time. Product fit in shoe with no modification and provides moderate arch support.

I've been using Powerstep Insoles for many years. I first gave them a try when I was experiencing morning heel pain, and had been to the doctor and was looking at much more expensive treatments. These things have taken care of my foot problems. Worth every penny.

As a long time sufferer of fallen arches I've tried many insteps, from custom made to cheap drug store ones, none have worked as well as the Powerstep Pinnacles. I've been using them for something like 4 years now, maybe longer, after a foot Doc sold me a set after having him look into my foot pain issue. I tried a couple of the better drug store ones but found them no better then having none. They might be okay if you just want some cusion though.
 I have worked up to the point where I have a set in each of about 5 pairs of footware, started with just one set but moving them from one pair to another proved to be too much hassle.
 If you have sore arches to the point you can hardly walk, see the doc then try these out (if he suggests the $200 custom jobs, try these first). It took a month or so for the swelling to go down after starting to use these so give them a chance. Do keep in mind that your results will more then likely differ from mine, I just got lucky.

I bought this because the arch is a little higher than many other inserts and the durable bed lasts longer than others I have used.  Be aware that higher volume is needed in you shoe to accomodate the higher arch.  Great cushioning and very durable

My 12 year old son ordered this for his 7th grade football team's helmet that is provided by the school.  It attached perfectly, and my son was very happy.  He did have to return another one that had a green tint to it because it wasn't the right size.  This one was the correct size however.  He is 12 yrs old, and 90lbs.

I had to order a new Tuxedo shirt since somehow the years have added to my neck size. If I had to go to a formal event, I at least had to wear a shirt that was comfortable. I do not shop much on line and I was leery of the results. Glad to report that this was a high quality shirt with corect measurements. Very pleased.
Decent shirt.  Just fit me, but it would be too small if I put it in the dryer.  Would recommend ordering an item slightly larger than your measured size.
Excellent quality shirt, better than I expected forthe price. Fits well, looked great with the tuxedo. Would definitely recommend it to anyone who needs a tuxedo shirt for occassional wear.

I received what I expected: a good quality 100% cotton shirt.  It was important for me to get a 100% cotton shirt for its feel and look!  The shirt is well made, no defect, no discoloration, right size and cut.  Delivery time was also excellant.

This is a great shirt! Though it is not Neil Allyn's. When I placed the order, it appeared that the shop has ran out of my size of Neil Allyn. So I get a very nice proposal to upgdrade it to Joseph Abboud Laydown Collar 1/2" Pleated 100% Cotton Shirt, which was $20 more expensive, but I was offered it for the price of Neil Allyn. This was a great bargain and I am very pleased with the shirt, which arrived on time and in good shape. As a result, I was looking quite classy at my graduation ceremony! :-)

The quality of this shirt is incredible! The fabric is thick but smooth as silk. It has real French cuffs, lay down collar, and comes with black studs. Button holes are convertible for buttons or studs, but cuff links are needed. The pleats are "classic" 1/2 inch wide. I have owned many tuxedo shirts, but the quality and style in this shirt are a stand out. It compares to shirts costing well over $100!! Frankly, while not inexpensive, it is a true bargain!
Great shirt for the price. Looks good & fits as expected based on size ordered.
Its perfect with one problem. You can't do anything about the sewn in plastic collar stays. I would be much happier if you could replace them so you always have that nice fine point.
This shirt does not have much room around the mid section,  I'm very disappointed. I do not recommend this shirt to anyone .

Beautifully made, perfect fit (16 32/33) with adjustable length cuff that I did not have to adjust.

Packaged like a $ 100 shirt.

The tuxedo shirt was perfect. It fit my husband true to size. Looked beautiful with his tuxedo. Very nice shirt.

This is an excellent tuxedo shirt which is extremely well designed and constructed. The fabric is of high quality and The workmanship impeccable. Fantastic deal for the price.
The neck size was correct. The shirt bodice was wayyyy toooo small.

I'm no expert on formalwear, but this is a pretty decent shirt at a very good price. And it has a couple of features that I didn't expect that make it an even better value:

1. Plastic studs are included if you don't own or plan to buy nice ones. From a distance, I think that they probably wouldn't be cheap-looking.

2. Buttons are sewn immediately below the stud holes so that if you'd rather use buttons, you don't have to use studs.

3. There are two holes for cufflinks on the "inner" part of the cuff that allow you to adjust the length of the sleeve. That can be very useful, since the sleeve lengths aren't offered at every inch increment. For example, you can buy a 34-35 or a 32-33, but if you need exactly a 34, the sleeve is actually closer to 34.5. The extra hole allows you to get a nearly exact 34". Overall, the shirt was a perfect fit for me. Not easy when you're buying online.

It really is 100% cotton, so it wrinkles pretty easily, but at least with a good starched pressing, it will look good for most of an evening.

The shirt was defective.  One side of the ribbed front was not sewn correctly and defect was not noticed until after it was drycleaned and needed for an event.  My order is past the return date, so I am unable to get a refund.  Buyer beware!

Mine arrived today and it is beautiful!  Brand new in original packaging and very well made.  I also picked up some suggested black stud buttons with chrome trim.  100% cotton so I will us spray starch and a warm iron after I fluff it up a little in the dryer to remove the shipping wrinkles.  Wearing it tonight for gala event.

Nice shirt, but when I put it on the first time I noticed a black stain on the back and a random green thread on the shoulder. Seems like factory seconds. I'll just go to my local department store or men's clothing shop next time...

I'd have to be constantly checking to see if my studs were undone. This shirt is a little thicker, looks really fine, and kept in the studs no problem, even kept in place while dancing and running to catch an uber. I highly recommend!

Extremely nice tux shirt!  I'm a big guy and the shirt fit well in the body without being a tight European cut or too baggy.  100% cotton with construction as good as any $100 dress shirt I have.  Has both buttons and slots for 4 studs as any good tux shirt should so you don't have to wear studs.  I'm buying one with the wing-tip collar next after seeing this one!

While its not a bad shirt at all - and for anyone who is on the slimmer side I would say its a great shirt for that price - it just didn't work for me. The reason being the pleats go all the way to the bottom of the shirt, this makes the shirt a little ridged and heavy when you tuck it in. Most tux shirts have pleats only till the waist line. To reduce the cost they must have done this, believe or not its cheaper to put pleats on the entire shirt than just till the waist line. That is all.
Good quality, fits well.

I was in a bind - my son decided last minute to attend Prom and we dashed around to the usual Macy's, Nordstrom, Brooks Bros - etc. I finally found a shirt in my sons' size at Nordstrom for $130 and thought I was stuck.  On a hunch I ordered this shirt on my Prime account.  It arrived in 2 days, I dry cleaned it the next day and he was off to prom the following night.  It looked GREAT and honestly, under a nice bow tie - links-studs and a sharp jacket and vest...I thought it looked just as nice as the Nordstrom one.  I grabbed my $130 receipt and returned the overpriced one to the store. And truthfully for a teen - they'll use it sparingly and I found the quality to be great.
This is a good quality shirt for the price; however, it does run small.  Take that into consideration when ordering size.
I have no problem wearing a 16.5 shirt in other brands, so I was very disappointed when this shirt did not fit.  At least, they should have labeled it as "slim fit"..  I wouldn't recommend it.
The shirt fit my husband perfectly and I love the collar which is less formal than the winged collar.  Had a few loose threads on cuff to trim but nothing serious.
I have this exact same shirt in micro fiber and it goes from drier to back with no ironing. This one needs iron every time, it looks great and feels wonderful but I hate to iron... Beware
The shirt received did not meet the description of the product being sold online. The shirt was poorly made and the stitches around the collar and the cuffs were disgusting.

Nice fit like the style and the feel, the shipment was fast.
So far I have only worn it once hope to ware it again.
when I finally went to press for wearing found bad stitching on collar that makes it unusable. Of course, return window had expired so I am stuck and mad.  Buyers beware

The material, fit, and feel are average quality, but the stitching around the collar and cuffs, obviously key in a formal tux shirt, were sub-par and sloppy [I had to spend a good 10 mins. trimming those areas with scissors].

The shirt was advertised as having 1/4 inch pleats.  The shirt that arrived had 1/8 inch pleats.  I can't tell you anything about the quality of the shirt because I didn't even take it out of the plastic bag.  I returned it the same day.

It did the job, but I honestly expected better.  First, I'm a big Brooks Brothers fan - their shirts are a little more mone (not all that much more), but not by that much more.  I was hoping for equivalent quality.  First, the cloth is decent cotton, but not the finest.  Not close to a brooks brothers or other similar national brand of shirt.  Second, and to me the bigger disappointment, was the fact that the shirt has built in collar stays - and if you've worn shirts with built in stays, you know they don't have quite the same collar quality and stiffness as one with normal collar stays.

Nonetheless, received complements all night - so paired with the tux and everything else, it did the trick.  Just wish it was a little higher quality for the price.

I ordered the shirt with FRENCH CUFFS, but instead, received regular cuffs with the cheesy cuff-link button holes next to the button on each side.  Very disappointed because I needed the shirt by Monday 1/14.  Please look at the product offered and tell me if these are French Cuffs!
This shirt is just what I wanted and purchasing was so easy-- no trip to the mall looking and not finding at the men's stores, Banks, Broooks Brother, Men's wearhouse, etc.
Built-in collar stays...that's all I have to say. All night my wife kept saying "something is wrong with that collar". LOL!

This is a wonderful tuxedo shirt!  True French cuffs, solid comfortable fabric, doesn't need a lot of starch to drape well.  No comparison with the cheap paper thin shirts from Korea.  A shirt that you will be proud to wear and that will look good on you.

Neil Allyn dress shirts are among the finest made. They are consistently true to size, comfortable, durable and classy. Beware of cheap imitations, and go with the best. After all, on what sort of occasions will you be wearing such a shirt?

Picture was misleading at the time, although now that I'm back out here, they've changed it. I bought this expecting fold-over wing-tip collars (seamless, the wing tips are just part of the collar, pressed and folded over). Instead, I received the cheapo-version, with the little fake triangle-tip collar bits that are sewn onto the rest of the collar. I'm usually a 16 36/37. Got the 15.5 36/37 because the last shirt I had was too big in the neck. Even with this size, the neck was too big, and the sleeves were too short. To make it worse, the shirt shrank after the first wash and hang dry. I ended up pitching this shirt after two uses. Ignoring the misleading picture, still rating this low. Good luck. The shirt is made is Dominican Republic (I was expecting to see a Made in China label). I bought the shirt for a one time occasion (the idea of renting a shirt worn by someone else has never been my thing), I'm very pleased with this purchase.

Lots of tuxedo shirts are thin and almost see through.  They are made of synthetics that can be uncomfortable.  Not this one.  This shirt is all cotton and is pretty beefy.  The shirt is built to last, and is more of a commercial grade tuxedo shirt.  Very heavy weight cotton.  Good quality shirt.  It also has a lot of room in the chest and torso.  If you are a bigger guy who wants room in his shirt, then this is a good option for you.  This is not an athletic or slim fit shirt.  If you are slimmer, you may want to consider another option unless the roominess of the shirt doesn't bother you.  If you wear the shirt with a vest, the roominess of the shirt is not as noticeable.  You will want to get the shirt cleaned and pressed before wearing it because it is all cotton and pretty beefy.  For the money, it is a very good quality shirt, just beware because it is on the roomy side.

Delivered on time as agreed. The shirt was a disappointment the collar was soft and needed stiffness if the wings were not going to be stitched down at the neck line like other shirts I have. this is an excellent shirt.  i love this shirt, however i did return it because it was too large due to the regular cut.  i'm still looking for the slim-cut version of this and would buy that is a heartbeat.  if a regular cut dress shirt fits you, then you should have one of these in your wardrobe.

Nice quality relatively inexpensive 100% cotton shirt. Good pleats and collar. Size was exact. Wing tips look nice but seemed a little floppy to me. I may hit them with a little spray starch before I wear it or I may just iron and let it be. Not a biggie.
Wonderful well-made, lightweight, and comfortable tux shirt. Very happy.
Very poor quality. Lots of threads hanging. The fabric doesn't have a nice feel to it and is quite thin with holes where the pins were. We will send it back.

What a wonderful tuxedo shirt. I laundered the shirt before I wore it and the shirt fit absolutely perfectly. The sleeves are a perfect length, the neck fits perfectly, the waist fits perfectly and I am delighted with this tuxedo shirt. I recommend this shirt 100%.
A nice heavy quality shirt.  Although, those of us with love handles, we would love to see a little more generous cut around the waist.

Unfortunately a Laydown not Wing Collar was Delivered.  To Amazon's credit, as usual, they made the return fair, easy, costless.  The quality looked good; didn't open the package.  Maybe will order again...
The button holes are too large for standard shirt studs.  The back of the studs slip out.  I ended up having to use the shirt buttons with the studs
I can't complain. A little pricey perhaps, but I need 100% cotton, and this appears to be well-made. I am in a tux a lot since I play the piano. I like it. Can't complain.

I bought this shirt for my husband, with all the description it had I thought it was going to be perfect but when I got it the cotton is thick, the collar was defective, one side bended more than the other and it did not look right.  The price of this shirt was around $45 and I just was in Washington DC and saw it for $20.  I had to returned it.
You need to brush it or wash it after it comes, cus the shape is not exactly the same. But it's a very cheap wig! Best buy!

I know this is a cheap wig, and it's not like a expected it to look like real hair, but I did expect that it would at least somewhat resemble the photograph.

The wig I received looks NOTHING like the wig in the picture! It was much longer and a complete mess - frizzy, flipping out in different directions, etc.

Further, it wouldn't fit on my head with my hair up! My hair is only an inch past my shoulders!

I would have sent it back, but I stupidly attempted to trim it. PLEASE don't spend your money on this product!

You pay for what you get. This is a cheap wig to buy, and it looks cheap on. It came very ruffled and distorted and I couldn't get it to lay flat. It looks not very much like the wig in the picture. For $10-15 more you can probably find a better wig. I ended up changing my halloween costume so I didn't have to wear the wig.
This wig did the job! Looked great! It was smooth and comfortable. It will last for more years to come.

I tried the wig on and it didn't fit right. Unfortunately, the company doesn't allow refunds on opened packages of wigs. I'm going to give it to Goodwill as a donation so I can get some money back for it.
I was unable to even get the wig on my head for Halloween. Not enough stretch/capacity for medium length thick hair.
Really beautiful wig for the money
This wig looks fake, but worked under the helmet I made. I would never want to wear it without that helmet though. It is much thicker than shown  and looks and feels like cheap doll hair.
I think they sent me the wrong wig. It does not look like the picture and it is longer than it appears. It does not have short bangs.
They sent me another type of wig and not the one showed and described. I was disappointed, but the wig is still a good product for its price.
Arrived in green... to late to change.  Kept it because it will come in handy for something sometime.
not like in picture at all...looked like a used wig from a thirft shop - hair not shiny and a mess even when brushed
Wig did not fit my wife. It was too small and seller would not refund purchase.
For such an inexpensive wig, it styled well and worked for what I needed it for.

I bought this on a whim--for my child's Cleopatra costume.  It fit my child's 9 year old head and my adult head.  It brushed out nicely and looked nice on (I did spay it with hairspray to tame it down).

this picture is different from the one that was up when i bought the wig so I'm kind of confused. The one i received was shoulder length hair. Anyways i bought the wig for my 6 year old for her katy perry costume. it was PERFECT for the look we were going for. The only problem was the bangs were very thick so i had to layer and texturize them a bit and i took a tiny bit off the length. Besides that the wig was great. I see people saying it was too small, it fit my daughter perfectly so maybe it works better as a children's wig.
Normal plastic shine, usable for stage
beautiful
I purchased this wig as part of a costume i will be wearing for my daughter's princess party. (Snow white) I tried it on and it fits great, looks great. I cant wait to wear it on that special day.
Overly Shiny, tangled, a bit too small for my head. Otherwise, not terrible. I have seen worse. I can make this work. It did not arrive too bent out of shape.

This wig was to be used for a costume but it is of such a cheap material that I had to purchase another.  The feel of the hair is horrible.  The wig is very thick and coarse but is such an obvious fake piece that there was no need to attempt to wear it as it would have ruined the entire look.
This wig was longer than I expected, but the quality was very good for the price. I ended up cutting it down to the length that I wanted and it still looked good.

looked better than expected when I took it out of the packaging.  Gently brushed it and wet it a bit to get rid of the static and it stayed looking great all night long.  It didn't slide around much either.
I purchased this for my Mia Wallace Halloween costume. It was longer than her hair. I also had to straighten this wig to make it the way it looks in this picture.
This wig was too small and it would not stay on my head( I have a normal size head) would not purchase again,
For $5, this is an outstanding wig. For $20, this would still be an outstanding wig. I couldn't have been happier with the purchase. It's a steal!!

Awesome
My so. Love it

We painted it and it was perfect
Great size
I bought this to go with a devil costume I bought. It came quickly and in a very long box. When I opened it the pitchfork part was very wobbley and there was extra pieces of plastic on it.
Not as pretty as picture, blue beads were light blue, not dark.
Took a star away since they put a sticker over the meaning of the beads. Pretty though.

I am disappointed in the way this ring looks when it is actually on a finger...It is VERY wide and the particular ring I got (I believe they are all different) looks crude and amateurish, with gaping "holes" in the wirework.  That said, when twisted the right way the ring is surprisingly comfortable and I think the ring could look very striking on someone with very long, very slender fingers.  I am planning on wiring stone beads into the gaps of the ring and giving it to my daughter, whose fingers are more suited to the style...we shall see what she thinks of it!

Unique and a good buy... and more sturdy than it looks in the picture.  I've been testing the loops with a reasonable amount of force and they do not bend.

Given the comments from previous reviewers, I was prepared to receive something that might look rather shoddy, but it is not shoddy.  Obviously not the best quality silver, but still good for the price.  Well-polished.

The inside has a small raised bit of silver (where it was soldered) which scratches my finger a little when I slide the ring on - unless I rotate it first to a better position.  It is not sharp and does not leave any marks, and once on, the ring fits very comfortably.  So this is a minor problem.  Obviously these imperfections will vary from piece to piece - this is the nature of the design.

The ring does not catch on my clothing.

Wish this ring came in size 5.  Other reviewers have reported that the sizes run a little smaller than standard, but I ordered the size 6 and it is still somewhat loose on my pointer finger.

The first day I got it, I thought it was alright even though it looked way better in the picture than it does i real life. I've had it now for three days and I realize how horrible it is. I don't want to wear it at all anymore, and I want a complete refund or exchange. It looks really cheap, and like something my little brother could have made for me in metal-shop class.
I just recieved my order.  This ring is true to size.  It is comfortable for a wide ring and is very delicate looking.  I know that I will enjoy this ring for a long time.
It is a really funky and fun piece of jewelery, but in real life it looks like something I could have bought at a jewelry dispenser
Got this today, and can't stop looking at it.  It's beautiful.  All who have seen it want one.  I cant wait to try more of their jewelry.

i love thing ring because it is so modern, and very cool. the wire is placed in such a cool manner, and i love wearing the ring! it does get stuck on some of my shirts, but otherwise, its a great ring.

I love this ring because it is so unique and people always have good comments to give me about it. My only complaint is that the ring is hard to keep clean. It will get tarnished (as all silver does) in the nooks and crannies which can be a pain. But I love this ring despite that!

This ring arrived very quickly and looks much like the picture. It is sturdy and has not bent or broken on me in the few weeks I've worn it. My only advice to buyers is to order a size larger than you normally would. I ordered a size 7 and it fits like a 6. Still love it though!
I received lots of compliments on this unique ring. But, the trouble that I've had getting just the right fit after resizing and keeping the ring from tarnishing makes it hard for me to recommend.

This ring is Beautiful and artistic, however, after wearing it off and on for about a week, one of the wire split, leaving two sharp ends exposed. i tried to sorta 'bend' them into the design, where they wouldn't be dangerous or noticable; but it just didn't work. after braving the danger, another wire or two broke.
i'd say i put medium wear on my jewelry and i realize this is somewhat fragile, but i definately expected more from it and was disappointed. Now i'm not sure WHAT to do with it.
I'd think twice unless you have a super-cushy job that doesn't require getting your hands dirty or frequent washing. DEFINATELY not a ring for a mom!!!

It looks exactly like the picture. The ring looks delicate but feels sturdy and is very unique but do be aware that it can easily snag on clothes. If you're unsure about the size, I'd suggest order a larger size because there's no flexibility in the ring. It's fairly comfortable but wide so be sure you really like it before buying. I'm very happy with it!

First, I *do* like this ring, however the rest of my review may sound.  That being said, the first thing I noticed was that it's sized rather small. It's quite a snug fit, so I recommend ordering a size up from what you normally would order.  The second thing I noticed was that it really doesn't look like the picture - the wire is much thicker than I was expecting and wasn't put together very well. I have to wear it *just so* so that you can't see the giant holes in the "filigree".  The band is also quite wide, so some people (such as myself) might have trouble bending whatever finger they wear this ring on.  Then today, as I was giving my finger a rest from wearing it, I noticed that IT TURNED MY FINGER GREEN! Sterling silver does NOT turn my fingers green. I could deal with wearing it a certain way and only for short periods of time, but turning my finger green? It's junk.

The ring is very lovely. Not quite the way it is pictured, but still very nice to look at and well-sized. But be careful and examine yours when you get it. Mine has a section that digs into my finger if I wear it "wrong," so I don't wear it that often.

This is not as pretty as it is pictured. The wire is kind of haphazardly melded together. It does fit well, though. I am a tad disappointed with the quality. The item did arrive quickly and in good condition (if a little ugly to begin with), though.

If you are thinking of buying this or another item...consider the other item.
